Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kenschwartz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris numerous times and this trip chose a small boutique hotel in St. Germain. The hotel staff was extreme friendly and accommodating. Our room was great. From the hotel we had access to numerous Metro station so getting around Paris was very easy. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay, but not a very good value”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: We know from past visits that Paris hotels are pricey but felt that the Hotel Le Six did not offer great value for the dollar (or the euro) and would probably look elsewhere on our next visit. (We chose it because of its proximity to our daughter's student housing.) It's located in a quiet block between the Jardins Luxembourg and Montparnasse, well-located for catching the Metro in just about any direction but a little sparse when it comes to neighborhood amenities. Our deluxe room was small even compared to our expectations...I guess the tiny balcony and street view made it deluxe. However, no complaints about the room amenities, bed comfort or (small) bathroom quality. Welcoming staff, good breakfast, some annoying problems with wifi but no other problems to report. Again, if you can get a great deal here it's worth considering but be careful about the price that you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel but far out location”
Reviews.Author: Travelqueen830
Reviews.Content: Had great time in Paris made better by our stay at this hotel. On two metro lines which was convenient since the hotel is farther out then we realized. But neighborhood is nice with great restaurants around the area. Rooms are small but well done. Might stay in closer for the same price. But if you want a modern boutique hotel, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique”
Reviews.Author: Telrod7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six is in a great neighborhood location close to plenty of restaurant and bars and local shopping and the uniqueness of Paris. The staff is the best. Every one I spoke with was able to help me and offered ways to make my trip better. The way they spoke very good English, really helped me and my wife. I would highly recommend this hotel and I plan on staying again the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful boutique hotel in a super location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: prico15
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at Hotel Le Six in Paris. The location was ideal. Close to the metro and ten minutes walk to RER which brings you directly to the airport. Service and staff excellent. Pleasant and accommodating. Rooms modern and all amenities. Molton Brown bathroom products and an excellent hair drier (always important for me). Slightly expensive but worth every penny. Buffet breakfast was excellent. Good selection and warm buffet also. Loads of restaurants and bars located just by the hotel. 5 minutes walk from the Luxembourg Gardens. An absolute gem!

Reviews.Title: “amazing home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sameatworld
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris for honeymoon and was shocked to find that our travel agent had booked us into a 3 star hotel that is ranked 1600 out of 1800 hotel in Paris on Trip Advisor! It was simply the most cramped and horrible hotel ever and I immediately started looking for an alternative. After reading so many good reviews, I rang up and spoke to the lovely front manager who was happy to accommodate us at late notice and very understanding. After dropping our bags off at the reception as the room was yet to be ready, we looked around Paris and came back to hotel after dark. And I'm currently typing on my laptop in the actual room which means that wifi is great. Imagine the surprise when we walked into an upgraded room (deluxe to a suite!) with champagne on ice and fruits on the dining table! Even had a personalized welcoming card. The suite is absolutely amazing with abundance of room and everything is so well laid out and thought through. It actually shames the Hilton Sydney's king suite that we stayed in for our honeymoon night. The suite is so quiet and clean that it makes you feel like you're at home rather than at a hotel. The bed is amazingly comfortable and we both now feel completely refreshed and ready for another day in Paris. I simply can't stop raving about the hotel and will certainly be looking for excuses to come to Paris and stay here on future medical conferences!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection: Stop looking and book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: treved
Reviews.Content: This is going to sound like a review written by someone employed by the hotel, but I promise you it isn't. We just had that pleasant of an experience at Le Six. First, months before we even came to France, I was trying to narrow down our hotel options and got in contact with Anne, who runs the hotel. Ann's responses were very quick, helpful, and in perfect English. Our interactions with her convinced us to book at the hotel, along with a friend's recommendation. When we arrived the room was very spacious for a European room. We had a junior suite, which by American standards was about as big as a normal sized hotel room. The room was in perfect condition, with beautiful modern decor. The lobby and other public areas were similarly gorgeous. If you're looking for a classic, old-Europe style feel this is not your place, but neither is it one of those super-trendy modern places. It was a nice middle ground that made the place feel new and hip without trying too hard. Stayed with my wife for three nights and everyone was very helpful. We had an unsolicited email from the concierge a few days before our arrival asking if she could help us with restaurant reservations, an offer which was gratefully accepted as our French is not perfect. Martin, the night clerk, was also especially friendly and helpful. The breakfast each morning was great. It was included in our room fee, so I'm not sure how much the extra fee is a la carte. I'm not sure we would have paid it, as there are plenty of cafes nearby that would have been a better value proposition, but since it was included it was nice to be able to just go downstairs, eat a nice meal, and then go back upstairs to get ready for our day. The hotel is perfectly located a short walk (under 5 minutes) from 4 different Metro stations. It was extremely easy to get to everywhere we wanted to go. In the end, I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It was our third hotel in Paris, and easily our favorite. Great location, great decor, and a wonderful staff that was attentive but not intrusive, and had no trace of any of those French-people-are-rude stereotype. Pros: Location Decor Service Value for price Cons: A few nitpicky things that will depend on taste, e.g. my wife thought the mattress was too hard, but I thought it was ok. Nothing that would prevent me from staying again or recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “A few steps to be a true boutique hotel, but generally acceptable”
Reviews.Author: tyst
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking the hotel is well managed. Professional staffs, elegant decoration ,cozy ambience, and the relatively spacious superior room are all its advantages. However, when the cost is taken into account, I believe the hotel should be better. The hotel charges for more than 200euros per night. For example, the breakfast is a little bit too simple for a boutique hotel. The variety of hams and sausages is small. Secondly, there is no complimentary mineral water in the room. Finally, the minor noise by the incoming and outgoing metro trains is a bit annoying for a sensitive person like me. Probably rooms on higher floors will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annick T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Six for a week to celebrate our 10 yr anniversary. It was the perfect hotel for us. Having stayed in St Germain before we knew we liked the area, but this location even exceeded our expectations. Last time we had stayed a bit closer to the Seine, but I much prefer where this hotel is situated. The street is very quiet, but close to Montparnasse subway, one of the most connected subway stops in Paris. Loved being close to Luxembourg Gardens. Rue Vavin is also super cute for strolling. The hotel is beautiful. Small, stylish, modern and sophisticated. We had a good size room and very comfortable bed. Beautiful decor. The bathroom was gorgeous. Small little balcony facing the street. The staff and service were incredible. Everyone was extremely polite, friendly and helpful. They gave great restaurant recommendations and called to make the reservations for us. Also gave detailed instructions to find the sweetest kid's toy store I've ever seen. I had a massage in the spa and it was lovely. Enjoyed the breakfast as well and drinks at the little lobby bar. We will definitely stay at Hotel Le Six the next time we are in Paris. If only it were sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: piaoApril
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for honeymoon in mid Dec 2011. Spent 5 nights in the lovely suite room. Service there was really good. They offered a lot travel information, recommend you restaurants and offered to book for you if you don't speak the language. The location is good. Between 2 subway stations, 3-5 walking distance to the stations. Breakfast wasn't too many choice tho. Food quality of room service was ok, can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: KSydelle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six was the perfect location for us. It's near two metro stops, tons of bistros, patisseries and the Luxembourg Gardens. The staff was extremely helpful, giving detailed instructions on how to take the metro to multiple locations, recommending restaurants, and generally attending cheerfully to every conceivable need that arose. We ordered room service for dinner once and it was delicious. The buffet breakfast was average, but the coffee was not good. Housekeeping never disturbed us during our weird hours of jetlag-induced sleeping, but always cleaned the room to perfection when we were out. Le Six is a nice hotel, has an appealing contemporary decor, and the rooms are fairly spacious compared to most French hotels. Given the price, it is an excellent value. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: niknak1234
Reviews.Content: We arrived here early after flying from Australia. The staff were fabulous. They allowed us to check in early and upgraded us. The hotel is clean, comfortable and in a great location. We look forward to returning for a visit when we're not so jet lagged.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BearLogic
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed quite a number of times at Le Six. She goes regularly on business at least once a year to Paris, usually staying at Le Six, and I accompany her when she goes in the summer. It is cool and trendy boutique hotel with a small bar area adjacent to the lobby, and really quite good and large buffet breakfasts. (We usually find a newspaper in the lobby on the way down to breakfast.) The rooms are very modern and well furnished on a small and fairly quiet street, and the staff is very helpful. (Once I had a dental problem while we were staying there, and the girl at the front desk was able to direct me to a dentist just across the way.) The first couple of times it was not terribly busy, and we were given a special rate for a suite, which was gorgeous with two rooms and a huge high-tech bathroom that looked that it belonged in Architectural Digest. Lately, Le Six might appear to be getting more discovered, so we didn't get the upgrades to the suite anymore. Generally, we now stay in a room one step up from a standard room, but these can tend to be rather small, and sometimes do not have a bathtub. Montparnasse is a pretty good area to stay in Paris, and a variety of internationally recognized restaurants are just two or three blocks away including La Coupole, Le Dome, and Le Select, as well as many well-rated neighborhood restaurants. Some supermarkets and grocery stores are in the area if you don't want to live out of the minibar, and a sushi place is next door to the hotel. Maybe we did enjoy it somewhat more the one time we rented an apartment for a month in Montmartre, but you can certainly do worse than stay at Le Six, and it's more convenient to book a room at a hotel compared to trying to arrange an apartment. We have stayed a number of times in the past at hotels near Place de la Concorde/Vendome, too; Le Six is certainly a better value than staying there, although that former area is more cosmopolitan than Montparnasse. And Le Six is near a variety of metro lines (without necessarily going to the stop at the train station of Montparnasse), making it more than reasonably easy to get around the city on business. It's a great place to stay if you're going for a fling in Paris, too. Considering the alternatives, Le Six might be slightly pricey, but its cool aesthetic can be very appealing to come home to. Because I have stayed there a number of times, I can see the positives and negatives to Le Six, but the fact that we continue to go back there says something in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boltreview
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a "gem". Firstly the staff could not be more helpful. We messed up some bookings for a show and they fixed this up for us, posted our mail and were generally more the willing to help where they could. The room was spacious, modern and exceeded our expectations. Great selection for breakfast. Close to metro lines and plenty of places to eat nearby. LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mafau
Reviews.Content: This really is the perfect hotel for a romantic weekend in Paris. I took my girlfriend away for a surprise weekend and we both loved it there. The room was amazing, it was a great size with lots of character and a lovely bathroom. The staff were always very friendly and could not have been more helpful. The location is very good, its on a quiet street just around the corner from a main road with lots of restaurants and bars. There is also a side street full of creperies so you are spoilt for choice. For metro access its great with two stations just around the corner and another two only a five minute walk away so you can travel to anywhere in Paris with ease.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Slossy
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 booked 2 rooms at the Hotel Le Six. This modern boutique hotel is perfectly located in the St Germain area of Paris (arr 6) and it is easy to walk to the majority of major attractions. A metro station is a short walk on Bd du Montparnasse which is awash with activity (restuarants, cafes, shops, theatre etc). The rooms are beautiful and reasonably sized for Paris. The bathrooms are spacious and luxurious. The rooms had a king size bed, and desk with free wi-fi access. Attention to detail was suberb with complimentary bath robes and slippers. On the ground floor is a bar and breakfast room all decorated in funky modern style. There is also a library of reading materials in the bar area. Newpapers are available in several languages each day. But it was the staff that made this hotel stand out. Nothing was a problem and any request was immediately attended to with a smile.They recommended some excellent restaruarnts close to the hotel. It was my wifes Birthday during our stay and we were offerred a complimentary drink at the bar prior to leaving for our celebratory dinner. The staff also sang happy birthday. The hotel is not cheap but when you balance this against the quality and service you will not be disappointed. And finally, there is a massage clinic on the lower floor to help you unwind. Our family were unanimous in praise of the Hotel Le Six. Superbe!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy2011_11
Reviews.Content: I COULD EXPERIENCE PARIS AND THE SIX HOTEL FOR A ROMANTIC WEEK END, COMING FROM GENEVA , we were highly and warmly welcomed by the staff who really care about us, Angela was a real goof tips advisor for Paris !! the room are modernly design and the bfast buffet is quite amazing , you can skip lunch time !!!. the location is perfect to discover st germain and metro connection easy to make a drop in any others places, i highly recommend the six that is the first for my girlfriend and i well done

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LBranden
Reviews.Content: We had a good room with a very nice bathroom at the Hotel Le Six. It was quiet, though a little dark in the room (it could use better lighting). We really enjoyed the location the most, as we were on a quiet street yet within close walking distance to many restaurants near Montparnasse. It is also close to 2 metro stops which is very convenient. The only problem I encountered was that when I tried to extend our stay by 1 night, the hotel could not accomodate us. I had originally reserved our room for that night, but changed it when we checked in, so it was my fault, but still very inconvenient that within a day, our ability to stay that extra night was gone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Charming, Upscale -- all in one!”
Reviews.Author: JenBlem
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in Paris, look no further -- Hotel Le Six is the whole package. It is in a quieter, upscale area, so sleep was not a problem at all. And, is it a short two block walk (5 minutes or less) to two different subway stations to take you wherever you want to go. It never took long at all to get to our destination. Location -- 5 stars Room size -- very happy for Europe. It was small by American standards, but it did just fine. The bed was a king -- perfect. It had enough room for our four suitcases. The bathroom was beautifully decorated and suited us well. However, the BEST part of the room was the huge french doors leading to the balconies. The long, flowing white curtains blew softly in the breeze -- it was so perfectly Paris!! Room -- 5 stars. Service was superb. If we asked for anything it was brought right away. They also assisted us in finding the fastest way to different places, and recommended some great restaurants. The first night they brought us a plate of macaroons. Very lovely (and good!). Every other night there were chocolates on our pillow, the bed turned down and the windows opened. It was such a breath of fresh air to arrive back to the hotel every night. Lastly, the night before our departure they left us a note thanking us for our stay, and asking if they could do anything else for us. They then proceeded to call us a cab to be there to take us to the airport in the morning. It was right on time and they helped us with our bags. Service -- 5+ stars!! The breakfast buffet was a little small, and not much to choose from. That is really the only negative thing I have to say. However, there is an authentic creperie one block from this hotel run by a charming man and wife (who do not speak English but were so nice!). Go there for breakfast -- you will NOT regret it! To recap: Location -- 5 stars Room -- 5 stars Service -- 5+ stars Food -- 3 stars Overall, this hotel was absolutely amazing. I highly recommend to anyone. Keep in mind -- I travel often and am a bit high-maintenance according to my husband -- so if I am this happy you will be too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location; Quiet yet Fun!”
Reviews.Author: caligirltraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day trip to Paris where I stayed at Le Six. I've traveled Europe and have been in Paris before... and the rooms are actually larger than standard European rooms. The bathrooms are modern with LARGE showers, the rooms are beautiful with wood floors (which you would think would be noisy but are NOT noisy). You are walking distance from a myriad of restaurants, pharmacies, metro stops, and the Luxembourg Garden (which is easily walkable in about 5-10 minutes and you will come out on the other side -- north side -- to the touristy area of the 6th). I am a adamant about staying at quiet places... I don't like to pay to be kept awake... and this place was wonderful. Though I did not have any noise complaints, if I had, I know they would have been taken care of immediately. The staff all speaks beautiful English and are willing and able to help out with everything from directions to making reservations for shows, restaurants, taxis, etc. (which is very helpful when you don't speak French). Angela, the manager (along with the rest of the front desk staff, gives impeccable and friendly service. Delightful! You can have a full buffet breakfast at the hotel (a smaller, and less expensive, on through room service) or literally walk around the corner to cafes every morning. Each night as we made our way in, we would have a cocktail at the bar. Anahyse, who runs it, has a wonderful selection of wines, etc. - including a very creative selection of yummy cocktails. Also a great conversationalist who can give you tips on Paris and French culture! I will absolutely be staying here next time I am in Paris (it feels like my new Paris home), and I will be recommending it to anyone I know who is going!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: bagg10
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, but at over two hundred pound a night - and i know this is paris - we thought the room was a little on the small side. other than that, the location is great and so were all the staff we encountered. i'd give it four and a half out of five.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TessaLynS
Reviews.Content: We loved our experience here. A friendly, english speaking staff, and the accomodations were lovely. The head bartender, Anahyse, has a creative cocktail menu as well as great wine. We loved having a nightcap at the bar each night. The hotel is close to two metro lines, the 4 and the 12, and its very easy to get around Paris from each. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location, good service”
Reviews.Author: obak
Reviews.Content: Located in central area of Paris, walking time to Notre Dam de Pari - 20 min.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambience, spotlessly clean, and modern furnishing”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three night in a classic room on a business trip. I was very pleased - the room was rather small, but usual for Paris, but it was spotlessly clean, and the furnishing was very new and contemporary. Bed was nice and the rain shower in bathroom a fine feature. Value was reasonable at a rate of 200€, but a bit on the high side. I did not use too many of the rather few amenities the hotel has on offer. I had breakfast a couple of mornings, which I found way too expensive for what you get (22€ for the buffet). I would go for a coffee and a croissant at a nearby cafe next time. The so-called fitness centre is actually a "fitness corner", and it is a joke. Do not count on using it. I did not try the spa. Wi-fi is free, which is unusual. The staff was at all times very friendly and forthcoming, which is not a given thing in Paris. Overall, I had a problemfree and nice stay, but I would need a few more amenities or better value to rate the hotel at 5. Hence, I rate it at 4, but would still say that could easily recommend the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the 6ème”
Reviews.Author: a-hotel-groupie
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this cute little boutique hotel in November. The situation is quite good, in the 6ème arrondissement, with two underground lines nearby. The 12 down the road (2min walk) and the 4 up the street (5 min walk). The room I stayed in was on the courtyard side. Note that courtyard here means a 10 square meter surface, so there’s not much to see through the window except a couple of walls, but it keeps the room very quiet, which is always a good thing in a big city like Paris. The rooms are small, but well arranged, and have high ceilings which give the impression there’s more space. The bed, cushions and duvet are very comfortable. Other than the bed, there are 2 nightstands, a wide but narrow kind of desk, a chair and a large mirror. The bathroom was also good. Nice design but not much more to say about it. There was no bathtub, but a large shower (I must admit I loved the stone floor that looked like wood). And something very nice in cold weather, a heatable towel rack. I still think the rates are high, but hey, it’s Paris, everything is expensive. There’s also a spa in the hotel but I didn’t get a chance to see it. The lobby is nice. There’s a sitting space with a good selection of magazines and newspapers. The breakfast buffet is good without being amazing: selection of croissants, bread, cereals, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, mushrooms, ham, cheese, yoghurts, fruit, and natural fruit juices. All in all I had a very pleasant stay, but if you’re considering spending most of the day out visiting, I’m not quite sure the price is worth it, depending on what kind of trip you’re planning.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: nytrvl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in the hotel Le Six for one night in October. We were on our way to a weekend in Bordeaux & the location proved to be perfect for us since I arrived in Charles de Gaule on a Friday morning & left from Montparnasse Saturday afternoon. The hotel was within walking distance (less than 10 min) from the RER station (Port Royal) and about a 5 minute walk to Gare Montparnasse. I arrived solo & don't speak French & was able to find my way just fine. Unfortunately when I arrived off the overnight flight my room was not ready so I dropped my bags & walked around the area. Luxemburg gardens is about 10 minutes away with shops in between. The hotel staff was really very nice. When I finally got into my room around 2pm & desperate to take a nap it was a bit noisy. We stayed in a deluxe room that faced the street. The room was average size for an American hotel room, probably a bit spacious for Paris standards & very nice & modern. Unfortunately the noise was coming from within the hotel- the doors shutting to other rooms, the cleaning staff banging around their equipment & getting supplies which I suspect were in a closet really close to our room. I understand most people are probably not trying to sleep in their room in Paris in the middle of the day but I was just really exhausted from not sleeping on the overnight flight & it really was disappointing to not be able to get a nap in. My husband was already in Europe & arrived later that night & he too had no issues taking the RER from the airport to the hotel. We walked to the St. Michel area for dinner & the next day before catching the TGV went to Trocodero & the Eiffel tower which was just a short metro ride away. We booked the room with the included breakfast & they had a really nice buffet selection- definitely worth it. Another bonus was the hotel had free wifi which made skyping with the kids back home nice. All in all I would say it was a good stay- short but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great value”
Reviews.Author: sarge75
Reviews.Content: First the positives. Well furnished Good location outstanding service at reception But the negatives are: Street noise. Quite loud indeed if you have a room overlooking the street. There should be some improved sound proofing. Cleaning - not the best standard the overall quality is ok but not matching up to the price. I think I could get the same standard or slightly better for 30% less.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mercurius_1
Reviews.Content: I echo the positive comments here, especially regarding the high quality of staff and the cleanliness of this hotel. Room was well appointed, bathroom spacious, and it was a very comfortable place to stay in a fantastic location near several Metro stops that will have you to the main tourist attractions along the Seine within 10-15 minutes. In addition, the RER train out to Charles de Gaulle is just a short walk down Blvd. Montparnesse. Plan for a 40-minute train ride at 9.10E per ticket. The hotel location was great (safe to walk around at night, no problem) and many good restaurants within an easy 15-minute walk, although I'd eschew the ones along Blvd. Montparnesse, which seem to thrive on their location alone, and seek out smaller, better ones tucked away in the neighborhoods. Call ahead. The good ones will book up completely. There were just two small problems. First, our room was too hot. When the digital thermostat in the room didn't respond to a cooler setting, I called the front desk and was informed that whole hotel was set to "heat," so I should therefore turn off the thermostat and open the room window. Well, the city street is really noisy, so having to open the window to keep the room cool at night was a major bummer for our sleep quality. Secondly, at a whopping 22E, the hotel breakfast is almost doomed to failure for its steep price, but this one hurt its own cause with undercooked hard-cooked eggs, a stray piece of plastic in the prunes, tepid juices, and tragic looking fruit cocktail that had languished in the bowl for quite a while. Regardless, we found this hotel to be very nice. Front desk staff were especially commendable for their willingness to answer questions (fluent in English) and help.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We arrived in the morning, but Angela had a room madeup for us, made us comfortable and made a reservation for dinner. The room was small but clean and comfortable with a great bed. The bathroom was modern with a wonderful large shower (unusual for European hotels). The hotel is located in a quiet but beautiful area between two major streets. There are great restaurants in the area. It's an easy walk to Luxenbourg Gardents, St. Germain, and good shopping. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were recently visiting Paris for our anniversary. When planning this trip, I was a bit concerned about Paris' reputation for being unfriendly to Americans. The staff at Hotel Le Six completely shattered this concern for us. Over four days, we met 5-6 different employees working at the front desk. EVERY ONE of them was super friendly and helpful to us. They helped us book dinner reservations, gave us directions, instructed us about transportation and made our experience wonderful. The rooms are very clean and up to date. Although the room was small for the price, the hotel made up for it with a comfortable lounge and bar near the lobby. Thank you to the staff for making our visit so enjoyable. Last tip: don't call a taxi to come to the hotel. They start the meter when the hotel calls them which runs the fee up. (I guess this is standard practice in France). Once we learned this, we found that we could walk 1 block and grab a taxi for half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norm23
Reviews.Content: I've been to paris couple of times before this trip. First two trips had awful experience with hotel staff attitude and cleanliness, but this one was great! Staff was super helpful. Would definitely go back to this hotel next year...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SuiCid3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and loved it! There were days when the staff left us little surprises upon our return to the room (fruit platter, cake platter) which was awesome! Room service was fantastic! Location is very central and there are a number of metros close by.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, comfortable stay in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: awellby
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Le Six and found the accomodations and service to be very good. The location is ideal if you are planning on doing a lot of touring as there are several major metro stations nearby, you can get anywhere very quickly from this area. The neighborhood also has a lot of good walk out cafe/restaurants and decent shopping but doesn't feel overly touristy. The room was clean, comfortable and good size. We came early and mid-week so were lucky to be upgraded to a lightly larger room. Everything was very clean and had a comfortable modern updated feel. The breakfast was excellent and a good value with a nice selection to fuel up before heading out for the day. The reception staff was very accomodating prior to the trip (responsive to email) and while we were there to help with dinner recommendations and reservations. Everyone was very friendly and spoke English when our attempts at French weren't enough. Overall Le Six was a great value and very nice stay with good service, we would recommend it to anyone looking for an upscale boutique hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Kais34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first 2 nights of our honeymoon in October. Very accomodating staff and perfect location on the left bank. Close to metro and several top cafes, bars, and restaurants. Very nice boutique hotel. I did feel it was some what over priced for the size of the room. However, then again it is Paris and just about everything is going to be expensive. Overall good stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Near Luxembourg Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Equities4me
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel in the 6th or 7th, I booked this hotel based on the reviews of my fellow tripadvisor members. You all came through again. This stylish boutique hotel is located on a quiet street close to the Metro - Line 12. It was clean, comfortable and nicely appointed. Most impressive was the staff. I had interactions with about 5 different people over four days. They were each, without exception, friendly, helpful, kind, and readily compensated for my poor French language skills with their perfect English. They even helped out by making dinner reservations on our behalf. The WiFi worked without a hitch. I'd stay here again without hesitation. I also recommend the small restaurant right across the street. It's a bit of a step back in time. The food is in the rich style of Lyon. Try to not be the ugly tourist - most of the other patrons will be older locals.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Culinarist
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights while on business in Paris. It is located pretty central in my favorite location in Paris, and close to a Metro. I was greeted by a more than friendly staff, and the room was spacious (very much so for being Paris), fresh and inviting. WiFi, TV and room for work was also very good. Breakfast: a nice and quiet area, with enough space between the tables. Attentive and friendly staff, newspapers, and an ample choice of high quality food. I have only to issues for improvement: Coffee, which I would like hotter, and the scrambled eggs which did not seem to come from fresh eggs (I may be wrong since I did not try it). In general: one of the very best of my hotel experiences in Paris. I look forward to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: sparsetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short 3-day stay earlier this year and had a good experience. Nothing spectacular, but clean, good service and a great location (nearby the Metro).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, central and great value”
Reviews.Author: CS_Clifford
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room at Hotel Le Six for two nights in October 2011, based on reviews I'd read at this site. My wife and I were not disappointed. Right from our arrival, we experienced the friendliness of the hotel staff that dominates many of the reviews. Our room was not ready (it was only 10:45am) so we were provided with a map of Paris and left our luggage at the hotel. After a pleasant day out in Paris, we returned to the hotel and checked in. Our bags had been delivered to our room (without us having to request this service). The room was very clean and tidy, albeit small, but for the price and proximity to central Paris we really could not have expected more. Bathroom was great, very modern with a decent sized bathtub, gorgeous shower and ample towels. After two long days in Paris it was a pleasure to find that the bed was extremely comfortable each night and there was certainly no problem sleeping! The buffet breakfast was good with a large variety of food available, everything from bacon and eggs to fresh strawberries. We had a drink in the bar the first evening. Again, the staff were very friendly; we experienced the same attitude from all staff. Not that this should be an expectation, but all customer-facing staff spoke fluent English. On the last day, upon checkout, we again left our bags to go out and about in Paris. The hotel staff gladly booked a taxi for us to the airport and when we arrived back to the hotel to pick the luggage up we ordered a coffee while we waited for our transport. A nice touch was when we went to pay for it and was told that it was provided free of charge, I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly be using it for our next Paris trip. There are two Metro stops a couple of minutes away from the hotel and it's ideal whatever tourist attractions you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Le Six, Paris”
Reviews.Author: Javier S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located on a quiet neighborhood, close to the magnificent Luxembourg gardens, less than a few minutes walking from 4 different metro stations and, if weather helps, you can enjoy a nice walk to the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, etc. A taxi to Orly airport takes less than half an hour. The hotel quality is, in general, very satisfactory, although maybe we were expecting something a little more luxurious for a 4 stars hotel. For example, the room was clean, noiseless and comfortable, with a huge bed, but the room itself and the bathroom were small (we booked a double deluxe room), with just a small bottle of gel and shampoo for 2 people. Buffet breakfast was also excellent, but again the cafeteria was really small. The hotel service was very nice and always ready to help. We also enjoyed a massage and sauna session (on a very small cabin...). In overall, we are very pleased with our stay at Hôtel Le Six, but there is always room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeslieTelAviv_Israel
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in, I realised that this was a great place to be. The vibes were outstanding and the attention given by the front office attendantrs was curteous and friendly.. The room was on the smallish side but very comfortable and excellently designed and the bathroom also smallish but very well designed, high quality towels and soaps. All in the hotel was outstandingly clean. The special service at the front desk was given by a man named Anders who went out of his way to assist us.Breakfast were unbelievably presented and tasty and so different from most Parisian hotels I have visited in the past., There is no doubt in my mind that if and when I return to Paris, this hotel will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: biggaplanet
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three nights at the hotel. It was a bit pricey and the room was small but everything else was ideal. Nice location near three metro stations and a quiet streat opposite a lovey restaurant which we went to each night. Helpful staff at front desk eager to give information and guidance. Would recommend the hotel even though it was expensive for the size of the room. No view from window which was a disappointment - it was a light well only.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Mattress”
Reviews.Author: bailejoh
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel in great location. Lots of superb restaurants round the corner. Nice quiet street. Room small by US standards but no problem. Bit pricy but others with high ratings and lower price were alerady booked. I am a healthy 54 year old with zero back issues, same with my wife. We both though the mattress was ridiculously hard. The last night could hardly get out of bed. PLEASE management take a trip to any Hamption Inn in the US (reasonably priced chain), you will find very comfortable mattresses. At these prices you can afford to upgrade. US hotels don't have just one pillow either.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jeff346
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe room at Hotel Le Six for the first night of our honeymoon in Paris. As we were on a budget we couldn't afford the hotel for all six nights, however the one night was definately worth it! We were upgraded from our deluxe room to a suite on the top floor in the corner overlooking the courtyard. The suite was large, and very nicely furnished. The welcome tray of treats and a bottle of water were a great touch. The bathroom alone was likely larger than some of the hotel rooms we had stayed in during our 26 day European trip. It had a deep soaker bathtub, and separate walk in shower. Nice quality Molton Brown soaps, etc, a towel warmer and skylight were additional things we loved. The bed was heavenly and a welcome spot to sleep compared to beds in other hotels we had stayed in. The included Nespresso machine was put to good use! We didn't opt for breakfast, but the hotel was central enough to the metro and Montparnasse itself that we walked or used metro to explore during our time there. Overall a great place to stay, with wonderful service and truly four-star, if not five, accomodations. If we're ever back in Paris, it will be at the top of our list of hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice hotel and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cgieyoung
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our 15th anniversary and found the room to be a good size by European standards. The staff was very helpful and the hotel is located in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: adler_9
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the hotel, I felt that this was the right place to be, The reception by the front desk personel was very personal and welcoming as were the attitudes of all reception personel during the entire stay.The decor was most tasteful and pleasant and the rooms and bathrooms although quite small ( usual for Paris) were fresh and most comfortable. Free internet which always worked well and fast is a wonder and great.. Breakfasts were oustanding with a huge choice of delighful foods and beverage. My compliments to the Management for being able to reach such a high level of service and if and when I return to Paris I will always choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris hotel you dream about . . .”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six is a fabulous boutique hotel. Rooms are decorated in great taste and modern, with all amenitites, loved the rain shower. Some architectural hints to the past are retained: tall window opens up to view a lovely courtyard, old style wire cage elevator (in addition to modern elevator). Breakfast was very good and will sustain you for your walk around the charming neighborhood. Staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. I took their recommendation and dined across the street at Michel's (the perfect French restaurant). Would definitely stay at Le Six again. Metro is close by. Invalides and Rodin museum are about 20 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DKH0630
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff were, for the most part, friendly. The room was smallish but nice. The location made accessing everything in Paris very easy. Much was within walking distance (which we did for most of our stay). When sites were a bit further out, the Montparnasse metro stop was 2 blocks away with multiple train options. There was considerable street noise on our side of the hotel every morning around 7 AM and better sound proofing would help with this. Also when asking about travel to the airport (GDG), we were pushed toward taking a cab though knew it would be expensive. After asking several different staff, one finally suggested the Air France shuttle which was less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel and significantly less expensive than a cab would have been.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeB2202
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Le Six. We received great help and support from the front desk staff, the rooms were clean and everything worked perfectly. The room was a bit small, but not uncomfortable and it certainly was not a limitation. You are walking distance from nice bars and restaurants in Montparnasse, as well as 2 Metro stations and a train station.

Reviews.Title: “A litle bit of home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Popeyebird
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris many times so I can compare good from bad. This hotel was fabulous. It was situated on a one way street which limited traffic and it was sandwiched between 2 big walking boulevards. You could walk to anywhere, which we did from this location. The air conditioning was on and worked well. Paris is a busy city so it is hard to leave the windows open as there is a lot of noise at night. We were comfortable the whole time and it was hot in Paris. The room that we had was large by the standard of Paris rooms and was very clean. The shower was very a good shower. Not always so in Paris as they usually have a hand held shower apparatus in tubs. We had a large bed that was comfortable and the sheets were lovely. No unexpected smells like other hotels we have stayed at. The breakfast was fresh and lots of choices. 3 hot choices and the orange juice was freshly squeezed. Coffee was real not Nescafe. The staff spoke English and were delightful and very helpful. Right across the street was a wonderful place to eat dinner or lunch. It is Chez Marcel and it is a cozy place with wonderful home cooking. I will do a seperate review on that one. Reservations are recommended as we saw them turn away several couples on the 2 nights that we were there. I really can't say enough about the placement of this hotel. We will now always go back to this little gem when traveling to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Six”
Reviews.Author: Spadafinos
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and accommodations. Front desk was alway ready to help and give advise on the places we wanted to see. Rooms were cleaned daily. Being a first time visitor to Paris we lucked out on a great, spacious and friendly hotel. Would go back and recommend to all my family and friends. Au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Disdrict 6 is Fabulous-Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: TexasgalNNorcal
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a Boutique Hotel! I decided to stay in a more intimate setting after our large hotel in Madrid.My research led me to LE SIX... Modern, eclectic, Beautifully decorated, neon, Mobiles, HARD WOOD floor rooms with high-end hardware. They have 2 elevators one fairly large and the other tiny!... LOCATION to two metro stops...Montparnesse and Champs...Just a few flat walking blocks in your out of the tourist area...YAY! Lovely,walking everyday.Near the Gardens and great reastaurants. The STAFF are THE friendliest and MOST helpful-Yes excellent English I have ever encountered in France. Evelyn is going to school for her Masters in Hospitality and it shows. They have a small spa downstairs and the steam room is available to all guests.My husband had a deluxe queen room with a balcony-QUIET! My mother in law had a deluxe standard one door down which was so nice since she is 87 yrs old. The beds are fabulous...Extremely clean and the rooms are medium size. We were hardly there to hang out so NO Complaints on size. We included breakfast which I recommend... American coffee with CREAM...finally! Multiple choices and the salmon alone with all the fixings is wonndrful, especially with their artisan breads. I ate the best raspberries everyday! They have a reading room with a giant mobile and sky light near their small bar area. It was nice to wind down our sightseeing and have a cocktail before heading out to dinner. Their recommendations for food compared to my research matched pretty well. I always took their advice and we were never disapponted. I WILL stay there again when I return to Paris. I just hope it will not take as long to return! Paris number 3 is a must. I will be posting about sights and restaurants in another post. I wanted to focus on LE SIX and it's fabulousness...

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaSarasota
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel is convenient to metro, shops, restaurants. The amenities at the hotel are wonderful. Wi-Fi codes are given per device (I needed 2) and even though they expire in 2 days you can get new ones quickly from the Reception. My only criticism which was never really resolved was that the bed's comforter/duvet was too heavy and hot. I requested a sheet to be placed under the comforter but no one seemed to understand me. I was given a sheet and I ended up making the bed myself. The next day housekeeping folded the sheet and it was on top of the bed. It was comical so I made the bed again. No one seemed to understand that I wanted to sheet to stay on the bed. Other than that it was SUPERBE . The closet space in Room 204 was very tiny and there were no drawers at all in the room. Paris is Paris and it was a dream trip. Would go back thetre tomorrow., The staff was wonderful. Buffet breakfast was delicious - especially the proscuitto and melon......

Reviews.Title: “typical Paris 4 star”
Reviews.Author: londonportsmouth
Reviews.Content: Good location but small rooms and average decorations. Helpful front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jasoncout
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in a great location. Room was small (from an American perspective), but very clean, and looked to be pretty new. Staff was excellent and very helpful. Location was on a side street of a very active and main street, so there was plenty to do even if you didn't want to walk very far. Easy to get to on the subway from the train station, and within walking distance of most of the typical Paris places to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Emann13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days and loved the hotel. The hotel is an easy walk from the RER B Port Royal train stop (so no need for a taxi or car service from CDG) and is located in the Montparnesse neighborhood which has plenty of restaurants, creperies and nightlife. The hotel is also right next to three metro lines, but we preferred to walk to most of our destinations. The hotel is on a quiet side street off the main Montparnesse boulevard and with the amazing king size bed we always had a great nights sleep. The rooms were very nice and clean and have free wifi. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - not great.”
Reviews.Author: B C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, but certainly nothing special. We stayed in a suite with our two children for two nights in August. The room was modern, clean and well maintained, as was the hotel. The suite had a bedroom with a king bed and separate living area - however the fold out sofa was open and the bed made when we arrived so there was no real suite - just two adjoining bedrooms. We overlooked the interior courtyard -no view. The air conditioning worked well (it was very hot in Paris when we were there). The staff were pleasant enough but not particularly well trained or knowledgeable. They seemed young and inexperienced. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation we were given the names of the main large and somewhat touristy restaurants on Boulevard du Montparnasse. When we tried to get a sense of the restaurants we were told they were "all about the same". No mention was made of anything special in the neighbourhood although we did later walk by a very well reviewed small bistro near Luxembourg Gardens and I am sure there were others. The breakfast was included with our room charge and was again - ok. There is apparently no cooking facility in the hotel - or wasn't the morning we were there - other than a microwave. A gentleman (not with our group) asked for the scrambled eggs which were on the buffet to be cooked a bit more and was told this could not be done as they had no more eggs. When he repeatedly asked that the eggs from the buffet be cooked more he was ultimately answered by a young woman who brought a box of pre-packaged scrambled eggs from the kitchen to show him that "this is the way they come". This revelation explained why my kids had already refused to eat them - stating that "they do not taste like eggs". Hard to believe you are spending $700.00 a night on a hotel that does not even not offer fresh eggs. (Even in Paris they can't cost that much!) Harder to believe that a hotel staff member would be standing in the middle of the breakfast room waving about packaged eggs in order to prove that she was right and the "customer" was wrong. While the location of the hotel is good enough and the rooms fine, I would spend my money elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ordinarymind
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel le Six, in the Montparnasse area. As noted by several reviewers, this is a great area in itself, and the hotel is convenient to two major metro lines, making it well suited for visiting all parts of Paris. Yes, the rooms are fairly small, and the common areas are also smallish (but not tiny). But everything is new, the bathrooms are comparable to NYC hotel bathrooms (if not better), and the place is well run. The breakfast is very good--- lots of fresh fruit, juice, good pastries, eggs/bacon, and great coffee. All told, this seemed like excellent value, and we'd happily return.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL EVER, MODERN, CLASSY, & STYLISH”
Reviews.Author: Samantha A
Reviews.Content: This was the first holiday for my Partner and I together so we decided on the Le Six hotel after reading all the reviews. Well to say I was impressed was an under statement this hotel was 100% amazing. The reception staff were the friendliest ever and so helpful and took their time to greet us and made us welcome. We even got upgraded to for free and the room was 1st class. The bathroom was amazing and super duper clean and you had toiletries from Molton Brown which smelt beautiful. The bed was massive and you got your own slippers to use that they give for free. We stayed for 3 nights and wished we could stay all week. We stayed in room 303 and had a street view with 2 huge windows. The breakfast was a hot and cold selection and catered for everyone and again the breakfast area was immaculate. The whole hotel is 100% modern, classy and elegant. They even had 2 lifts, one like the olden days but still elegant, which can only fit 2 people. But the main one had red leather plush walls. The hotel has a spa area in the basement, which had a lovely staircase leading downstairs and the whole area was out of this world, truly amazing. All the hallways leading to the bedrooms are so beautiful and elegant as well and I would definitely stay there again. However, if I had to say one thing that was negative, is that the drinks in the hotel are not cheap and we would have got double the drinks had we had gone out to drink on one particular night.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, friendly and very clean hotel in a nice, quiet location-loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KathandKel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Six for a few days in August. The hotel is situated in a quiet side street off Bld Montparnasse. The room was larger than most Paris hotels, very clean and modern. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I needed to make an important phone call and my mobile wasn't working. I was able to use their phone at no cost! Breakfast was very good with a wide selection to suit everyone if you choose to stay half board. There are three Metro stations close by. In the evening, however, it is probably better to go elsewhere for food, entertainment etc as the local cafes and bars are horrendously expensive. Overall, lovely hotel, excellent staff, nice quiet location. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to middle-aged couples looking for somewhere to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Paris. (The hotel also has a spa but we did not use it). I would recommend asking the hotel to email directions to Rue Stanislas as it is very difficult to find on most Paris street maps.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michele S
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was perfect for our trip to Paris! It was on a quiet street but close to the metro and trains. Many very good restaurants were nearby where we were able to dine outdoors along the sidewalk. As english speaking people in Paris, we never had a problem at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and all of them were able to speak to us in english. Our only complaint - the beds were hard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: AlexWongSg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights while on my honeymoon. We enjoyed our stay very much- a lot of nice touches with eager, helpful and polite staff. Service The staff (that can speak english) are friendly and really quite excellent- a level of service that almost rivals hotels like King George V/ Four seasons. Everyone greets you on sight, reception staff remember your name etc. Angela the receptionist (? at least i think she's a receptionist) was really MOST EXCELLENT and bent over backwards to help us secure nice restaurants all over paris. ALL hotels need someone like her who knows her food scene intimately well! :) One or two staff in the evenings and early mornings that dont speak english so well, but are very friendly still and i got around that with babelfish translator. ( provided of course with the free WIFI. Location - most excellent location, situated a stone's throw between two different metro lines, getting anywhere at all was a breeze, not to mention the endless choices of eating places nearby, this hotel was a real gem for location. The surrounding area is generally well lit and feels safe as there's pedestrian traffic nearby at all times of the day. General hotel environs and rooms. Did i mention FREE WIFI? :) Decor is nicely done and tasteful, fun without being garish. Hotel and rooms are neat and extremely clean. There are two lifts- the service lift is roomier and actually runs faster than the guest lift. Rooms are not the largest around, but big enough with a VERY comfortable king sized bed. Decor in the rooms is again very tasteful and decently lit. The amenities are excellent and we liked the provided slippers, the little chocolates left in our room every day by room service, an iron and ironing board, slippers, shoe cloths- the hotel seems to have thought of everything. Food Room service is provided up to 11pm daily by the L'Atlier restaurant nearby, but the resturant itself is 2 mins walk away and open 24 hours, not to mention about 10 euros cheaper than the room service. So why bother? Breakfast is great and has a wide spread BUT IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE HOTEL PRICE. Be careful of that! If its not included its something like 20 euros per person, which is a bit pricey considering I can get a good crepe outside for 10-15 euros. In summary, a very nice boutique hotel with most excellent staff and a lot of very thoughtful touches. Slightly on the pricey side, once you count in the cost of breakfast, but I'd be more than willing to stay here again for the most excellent service and well kept rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk and housekeeping staff made our stay an enjoyable one”
Reviews.Author: TAalice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Six for 6 nights. What I love most about this hotel is their nice and friendly front desk staff (esp. those serving in the mornings and in the afternoons) and the great housekeeping staff. The room is always cleaned properly during our stay. We like the modern decor and the very, very good condition of the room interior. My husband loved the big and comfy bed. Environment is quiet and location is close to Notre-Dame-des-Champs, Vavin, Montparnasse-Bienvenue metro stations and Gare Montparnasse. Morgane from the front desk had been providing me helpful information about the hotel in general right from the start. We are very delighted to receive the room upgrade. Angela was always cheerful and welcoming and very helpful with giving directions and cruise information. My husband and I really love the Seine river cruise Angela recommended to us. The cruise dinner wasn't cheap but it was worth the money and made our last night in Paris a memorable one. Evelyn was the one who received us upon our arrival and she was very friendly. Check-in was very quick. Morgane, Angela and Evelyn all speak fluent English. I agree with previous reviews that the evening staff members apparently cannot communicate very well in English and I wish we had communicated with the morning staff when we needed to see an English-speaking doctor. Overall, we love Hotel Le Six. It was very nice to see a nice welcome fruit plate when we returned to the Hotel on our first night, and to see our room perfectly cleaned EVERY night. Thank you to those from Hotel Le Six who made our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: Leo-Belo-Horizonte
Reviews.Content: Those 2 words not always come together: friendly and sophisticated. But they're good words to present "Le Six". From the front desk (Angela was specially kind) to the maids, everyone was very friendly. The room is very nice and the breakfast splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quite rooms; but poorly trained staff”
Reviews.Author: Ankur g
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel on honeymoon trip. Pro: Nice morning staff. Nice hospitality, clean and quite room. Cons: Poor english speaking staff in evening and morning. On last day of my departure, I called the reception and asked to book a taxi to the airport. Taxi arrived 30 minutes early and I was informed by the hotel staff about its arrival. When I questioned its early arrival, I was told over the phone that the txi will not charge anything extra (no waiting charges). However, when I paid for the taxi, it charged me 22 euros as waiting charges. I immediately called hotel reception and informed him about the charges. The receptionist suggested that I have to pay for that and there are always waiting charges in Paris. I was so disappointed with the lack of communication and I have to unnecessarily pay 22 euros from my pocket. I felt that I have to pay for something which I never used.Though staff was nice, I would suggest them to hire better English speaking staff in the evening so that these incidents never happen again. Not very conveniently located from Paris attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WinegeekVancouver
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this boutique hotel for seven nights by way of a package through Air Transat. We really enjoyed our stay here. It has been recently renovated. Our bedroom was a decent size with a great king size bed. Windows opened onto a small balcony where we could sit at a small bistro table, have happy-hour and soak in Paris. The breakfast was tasty and substantial (although, after seven days some variety might be nice). It has a small lobby bar where we could get a glass of Champagne from Tomas the bartender every night before bed. The location is excellent. Quiet, but only two minutes from the Luxembourg Gardens. Very close to three different subway stops on three different lines, so it made it very convienient to get around Paris. Also very close to some excellent seafood restaurants. For Hemingway fans, the hotel is about a block from where he lived (at 113 Rue du Notre Dame du Champs), and therefore many of the places he talks about in A Moveable Feast are located closeby. The staff were wonderful. Engaging, friendly and helpful, and all spoke excellent English. The cost was a steal relatively to the overall quality of our stay. We will definitely be back to this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great air-conditioned hotel in 6th arrondisement!”
Reviews.Author: DC-Dad
Reviews.Content: Many fine hotels in Paris are not air-conditioned. This is OK some times of the year, but not in August, when we went. This hotel is clean, with modern, American-style bathrooms & flat-screen TVs with channels for every language. There are free newspapers in the lobby in the morning. The staff is knowledgeable, multilingual, and friendly. As with most center-city Parisian hotels, the rooms are small and feel smaller with a queen-sized bed. But the bed was extremely comfortable. The location, of course, is perfect, near many sites and near multiple metro and bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “Our first boutique hotel, but not our last!”
Reviews.Author: ilovecalculustoo
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel in TripAdvisors top 10 in Paris that we found an opening and could afford. It was a little more than we usually spend on a hotel, but it was for my first trip to Paris, a dream come true, so we decided to splurge a little. It was so worth it. It is the perfect location - close to Metro stops for every line & RER. It's in a nice neighborhood away from any street noise. Just around the corner we found a street Creperie the first night with the most unbelievable crepes! The room was indeed small, but so nicely laid out with 3 wardrobes, so plenty of closet space. The bathroom was very large with a huge walk-in shower, really lovely. We didn't try breakfast as it was pretty pricey. All in all, we loved everything about it! So glad we found this unique place on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, I will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: holidaysRmyHobby
Reviews.Content: Me and the boyf stayed here for a romantic weekend and it was a wonderful hotel, situated in a the most perfect part of Paris, next to the beautiful Luxemburg Gardens and a short walk away from some of the best bars and restaurants. Plus it is out of the Touristy area where you can get ripped off. The staff were so friendly and booked restaurants for us. All were brilliant. I was a little worried about not being able to book a taxi from other reviews, but there were no problems what so ever. Thank you Le Six for such a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Six, a boutique hotel with true savoir-faire for a perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: docneveu
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travelers. As Trip Advisor has always permitted us to better judge the quality of hotels, sites and restaurants in Europe, we wish to share our recent experience with what was for us a new hotel in Paris where we spent ten nights last June. We are French Quebecers, we have always felt very much "at home" in France and Paris, even though our French accent is different. It was our eight visit to Paris last June. We have previously stayed in charming hotels near Place Vendôme, in the Latin Quarter, near La Sorbonne university and in St-Germain-des-Prés. In April 2008, we stayed for the first time in Montparnasse at the Littré hotel, nice, good service but old style rooms, a little stuffy! Through Air Transat services (we also flew with this airline), we learnt about another hotel, Hotel Le Six, a boutique hotel very near where we had stayed in 2008. We had fully enjoyed the sixth arrondissement, around the Gare Montparnasse, the wide choice of restaurants, groceries, boutiques, great public transportation. So we decided Le Six was worth a try, and believe us we did not regret our choice at all! It was more expensive than the hotels where we had stayed before, but we enjoyed the more modern, zen decor and ambiance on the quiet Stanislas Street. Air Transat was offering two room classes: the classical and superior. We opted for the superior and were upgraded to superior deluxe, the difference being in the overall size of the room. Mind you hotel rooms in Paris are generally moderate size to sort of small compared to North American standards, we were quite pleased with our Superior Deluxe on the fifth floor. Huge confortable bed, two large windows, great bathroom with shower and bath, bathrobes, iron and ironing board, flat screen TV, good choice of channels except TV5 (for us it is a useful channel), small noiseless mini fridge. Not enough closet space however, but no problem, we used the back of two chairs to pile a few tops and our small cabin luggages placed at the foot of the bed to serve as additonal drawers. Oh, and for women with thick, long hair, there is a standard hair dryer not the small attached-to-the-wall kind!!! We did not use the Spa, did not have time! Nice breakfast room, with buffet breakfast, smiles and great coffee every morning as we arrived. Professional service throughout, we heard perfect English and of course had the pleasure of speaking cheeringly in our own mother tongue. Delightful boudoir under a large verrière, choice of interesting touring magazines, small bar. The reception clerks always patient, smiling and ready to help the customers in any way they wish. Stanislas street is just lovely with a church just at the corner of the Montparnasse Boulevard. Our room was on the façade and we were never bothered by the urban hustle and bustle. We were near the Gare Montparnasse, famous restaurants such as Montparnasse 1900 (with its fantastic Menu La Belle Époque, dined there twice, do reserve), La Coupole (dined once after seeing Woody Allen's Midnight in Paris movie, what a special evening that was), there is La Rotonde and a more family like fish restaurant very popular with the locals called La Criée. Hairdressers nearby, cinemas, the FNAC bookstore where you can purchase tickets to exhibitions and shows, all kinds of boutiques. We could easily walk to St-Germain-des-Prés, the Luxembourg Garden. By bus, it was also very easy, straight to the Arc de Triomphe, or to Garnier Opéra, or the Bastille Opéra, or near Alma Marceau for a short walk either to the Eiffel Tower, or the Quai Branly Museum (visit at least the outside garden!), or to the Champs-Élysées Theatre, or to get to the Bâteaux-Mouches for a wonderful promenade on the Seine, straight to the Louvre if we wanted. Believe us, staying in Montparnasse is a great way to explore Paris for the cuisine, the culture, the cinemas, the boutiques, the reliable bus service (never waited more than five minutes) or metro and of course to come by train or leave by train for instance to Bordeaux. Le Six is now our favorite base camp in Paris and we recommend it without hesitation. We used for the first time the "Paris Shuttle" service from and to the CDG airport. To get to the hotel we had a shared ride with other travelers and had to wait a while at the terminal, so we changed the formula to go back to the airport and opted for the private transfer just for a small additional charge. We arrived at the hotel just before 1:00 PM, we were escorted right away to our room and we left on a quiet Sunday morning, our shuttle arriving at 8:00 AM sharp and got the Terminal 3 at 8:40AM! Our exchange through e-mail and phone was perfect with the Shuttle personnel, we will definetly use that service again but the private not shared transfer both ways and our e-mails to the Hotel Le Six were always answered swiftly. Do visit the web site, you will be tempted. Bon voyage, Vive Paris! Come rain, come sunshine, you will never be bored in Montparnasse. Two avid lovers of the City of lights!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Pam46375
Reviews.Content: After looking at the photos on line, we decided this would be a great place to stay - - it looked roomy & a good location. However, some of the pictures you see on line were certainly not our room as they show an additional chair in the corner - - believe me there was no room for an additional chair anywhere in our room. As far as the cleanliness & the staff's helpfulness, I would rate this very well. Again, the size of the room was far too small (and that's an understatement). You could barely squeeze into the 1 chair that was in front of the bed at the desk. Not able to manuever around easily with 2 people in the room. Ammenities were not filled as they were used. They actually took our 1 bar of soap, and we were left without - - had to request a bar from the cleaning staff. Overall I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone - - especially considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, spacious and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FlowingEzy
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with really great front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, but certainly not 200 meters from Montparnasse station - more like 800 meters, which makes a difference if you're lugging suitcases. The room was very small, which I guess is normal for Parisian standards, but at 250 euros you'd expect a little more. Breakfast (included) was good. We booked a taxi to the airport the evening before, which allegedly was confirmed but failed to materialise. Reception was unable to procure a replacement and in the end advised us to walk to the RERtrain station - I realise this is a Paris-wide problem, but surely that's not acceptable? There has to be a way of solving this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable visit...5th year and more to come!”
Reviews.Author: Artiste75
Reviews.Content: From a delightful, delicious petite dejuner to a peaceful and restful sleep!!! I delivered my custom-designed painting to Le Six for the Hotel Reception area and was pleased to see that it has found a perfect "home" in the reception area! The service while once again staying the week at the hotel was excellent..the entire staff was helpful and most accommodating when I required assistance. I hope to make this hotel my stop each year when traveling to Paris. Its the type of hotel you would expect to see in such an elegant city....Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location...”
Reviews.Author: britcanuckusa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Hotel Le Six for our 10th anniversary (leaving our 3 little ones behind!). We have both been to Paris separately, but this was the first time visiting together. The hotel was wonderful - modern, comfortable, and in a superb location. The staff members were all very polite and friendly, and tolerated (perhaps even appreciated?) my lame attempts at speaking French. Alex, the Bartender, was our favorite, providing us with wonderful restaurant recommendations, and keeping us entertained with discussions of French life and politics. The only disappointment was the "gym" - really more of a little nook with a couple of out-dated pieces of cardio equipment (this wasn't a huge problem, though, as we were able to run around the Jardin du Luxembourg every day before walking for hours). My husband was not a huge fan of Paris before this trip. His opinion is now much different, and I'm sure this is, in part, thanks to the hotel and its fabulous staff. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: amy70
Reviews.Content: We visited Le Six for a few nights as part of our honeymoon. It's a great little hotel and ideally located - short stroll to about a dozen restaurants and bars and just around the corner from the Metro. The RER station (Port Royal) is around 10 minutes walk and it's a pleasant walk through the Luxembourg Palace gardens up to the river and beyond. The rooms are quite small but everything is modern, clean and very comfortable. The only down point is that there are no drawers to put your clothes in. Breakfast seems expensive at Eur22 each however, it's actually great value compared to paying Eur11 for a coffee, juice, stick of bread and a croissant outside. You get everything from fresh fruit, yogurts, cereal, pancakes, bread, croissants, pastries, cooked meats, cheeses as well as eggs, sausages, bacon, mushrooms. More than enough to set you up for the day. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant little hotel, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Millerpj
Reviews.Content: My first ever review, my motivation for this is as a result of a enjoyable stay at Le Six made even more so by the excellent staff. We were welcomed by a smile and a receptionist who could not have been more pleasant and helpful. She directed us to our room which was stylish, bright, very well equiped and very comfortable. The bath/shower room was very much high spec! After returning late from dinner we wanted to find a venue with live music. The night time receptionist could not have been more helpful, phoning a number of venues to find out what music there was and what time it would finish. He then directed us and we had a really fun night. Needless to say we will return

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: CMM100
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six was a lovely place to stay. It is located off a busy street in a quiet neighborhood. The location is convenient to many metro stops and there are a number of bistros and shops in walking distance. We were pleasantly surprised when we received a complimentary upgrade to a larger room when we arrived. Our room was spacious and quiet. The bathroom was large, there was plenty of hot water and the room was spotless. The bed was very comfortable and the free internet was a real bonus and easy to use. The staff was friendly and spoke English well. The gentleman at the the reception desk at night was particularly helpful and friendly. I highly recommend Hotel Le Six. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-We we're very happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: tripthisout
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Le Six. The room was extremely clean, comfortable, modern & perfect for our week stay in Paris. The entire staff is friendly & helpful, which is what a traveler wants & expects from their hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location for use of the metro. It is within short walking distances of 3 metro lines. There are many restaurants, shops & activities down the street, but the hotel itself is on a quiet street. We've stayed at several other Paris hotels in the past & the Hotel Le Six is the best stay yet. Honestly, we have nothing negative to say. When we return to Paris, we will stay there!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: pat1030
Reviews.Content: liked this hotel very much. The room we had was small but very well appointed and with very effective air conditioning. The housekeeping was excellent - the rooms were spotless and clean towels every day. The bathroom has a mini spa feel with Molton Brown toiletries, big fluffy towels and large bathrobes. And the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is small and does not have a restaurant though it does have a nice bar in the lobby and pleasant breakfast room. It also has a nice spa facility (effectively a steam room) which you book in advance and is for your sole use, which was lovely to use after a days sightseeing and really prepared us for the evening.
