The free wifi was also a bonus. Located on a quiet street with lots of restaurants just a block away. The Metro stop is about a block or 2 so you can stay here out of the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas but still get to all the sites you want to see quickly. The only issue we had was that we had to ask for our room to be changed because there was construction going on next door and we were woken up by banging each morning. We were moved to another room and given a discount on one night's charges.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, friendly & informative staff, beautiful rooms - made our time in Paris perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller1970
Reviews.Content: Room 407 particularly nice, quite, spacious and romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: copperycat
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. The room we had was small but very well appointed and with very effective air conditioning. The housekeeping was excellent - the rooms were spotless and clean towels every day. The bathroom has a mini spa feel with Molton Brown toiletries, big fluffy towels and large bathrobes. And the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is small and does not have a restaurant though it does have a nice bar in the lobby and pleasant breakfast room. It also has a nice spa facility (effectively a steam room) which you book in advance and is for your sole use, which was lovely to use after a days sightseeing and really prepared us for the evening. The free wifi was also a bonus. It is located on a quiet street off the Bvd de Montparnasse which has many shops, cafes and restaurants. There is an excellent restaurant Chez Marcel directly opposite the hotel. And it is very close to two metro stations. There are also two cinemas nearby which show some English versions of films, which my 15 year old found was a treat after sightseeing all day. If you want a big bustleing hotel with lots of facilities, this is not for you. However if you want a quiet haven in the middle of Paris, this is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at quailty location”
Reviews.Author: Canadianvisitor075
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, helpful, and professional. Although room was smaller compared to North American standards, everything was modern and clean. Bathroom attractively tiled although a bit dark. Beds were really comfortable. Buffet breakfast was an excellent start of the day. Front desk staff took time to answer all questions and saved us time by giving precise directions to Paris' significant sights. Hotel location is on a quiet street but near metro stations and a variety of eateries. Would return for a stay without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in Hotel Le Six, Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: nordwand
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before. It is a small boutique-style hotel in a quiet situation but with easy access to Bd Montparnasse, St Germain de Pres and Aeroport Ch de Gaulle via RER. Service is good and staff are friendly and helpful. My wife likes to take spa treatments and the rooms are good. The thing that really swings Le Six for us though is easy access to areas / acitivities we want to explore in Paris. The restaurants of Bd Montparnasse are 100m away. Don't miss Falstaff's bar if you love beers and Chez Marcel for rustique French cuisine. We tend to walk a lot on city trips and the walk up to the river is just enough for a gentle stroll, to admire the architecture and to develop a need for a coffee on arrival. The markets on Bd Raspail are also near are interesting. If you decide to follow our advice search for deals. We obtained a Six and Luxe deal which although pricey up front included a lot of items which we would have purchased on arrival (spa treatments) and a complimentary bottle of champagne which really added to the trip. This was all rounded off by being upgraded to the suite which is very comfortable. We will definitely stop here next time. Haven't gone running in Jardin de Luxembourg ? next visit

Reviews.Title: “All that we wanted and more!”
Reviews.Author: beth3380
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before picking a hotel in Paris, and the reviews of Hotel Le Six were extremely accurate! The service was excellent, our room was great and it is extremely well located in Paris to walk comfortably to all of the major sites! The balcony was an awesome bonus of the room and a great way to watch the Parisian sun rise and set each day!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: angela_plant
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, beautiful and contemporary. They serve a fantastic breakfast everyday, but it is not open for lunch or dinner. There is a bright sitting area great for reading and the small bar in the front lobby is lovely. We had 2 rooms. Our room had 2 beds, small balcony, desk area and great washroom with a large shower. It also had a bar fridge and microwave with great closet space. Many boutique hotels we've stayed in the past do not have enough closet space or small shelf space (especially in the bathroom). The other room was even larger with a larger desk area and a jacuzzi tub. Rooms very clean. The hotel is 6 stories with 2 elevators and a wide staircase that winds around the elevator making walking very easy. As much as we loved the space, the staff is what made this hotel so special. From my emails before our arrival to every member of this staff was fantastic. They all spoke english, some better than others. Each member acted as if we were their favorite guests and made all our reservations and tour confirmations. One went out to purchase an adapter for us, another dealt with a unruly cab driver. They left notes in our room regarding confirmation of reservations etc...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anon2248
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and great room. Stay here, you will be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: shotzy60
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself experienced our first trip to europe this april- and Hotel Le Six was a perfect choice for this! Being a skeptical new yorker I was curious as to how it would go....it was fabulous!!!!! the staff was cordial, young, informed and enthusiastic. They have a wonderful command of english and a willingness to help you at every request. We were upgraded to a more luxurious room that was beautiful! Located steps away from 2 Metros that took us everywhere, and Luxembourg was a few minutes walk...We have already decided to come back and stay here again, as Paris captured our heart and Le Six was the perfect answer to call home for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadadish
Reviews.Content: Great room -- I especially like hardwood flooring instead of carpets in a hotel room -- modern bathroom with the best shower I've experienced in a hotel. Very pleasant, accomodating staff. Excellent breakfast which was included in room price. I didn't hear any noise whatsoever in the room, excpect in the mornings around 7:30 due to city street garbage pickup and street cleaning. I've stayed in other hotels in Paris (and Europe for that matter) and that's the norm. I walked from the hotel to E. Dehillerin to pick up a copper pot and by some North American standards it could have been considered long (40 minutes or so), but that's part of the experience -- lots of art galleries and interesting shops along the way, cross the Seine, stop at a cafe for coffee. Paris is a walking city, unlike most North American cities where everyone tries to park right beside the entrance. That's probably why so many Parisians are thin! I highly recommend Le Six! And, Chez Marcel, the small restaurant across the street was excellent with traditional french food.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HeyJude64
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Six is the best hotel we have ever experienced. The concierge services were outstanding. Each person working in this area were very helpful, friendly and accommodating. Anything we needed was provided to us, with many nice surprises along the way, including help translating directions to taxi drivers and helping us use the Metro, which is very close by. The hotel is on a quiet street, but only a short walk to a thriving shopping area. Local food was wonderful, and the staff suggestions were terrific. The room we stayed in was beautifully appointed and gleaming clean. We highly recommend this charming boutique hotel that was quintessentially French in beautiful Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a close to metro location”
Reviews.Author: VATravelfamily04
Reviews.Content: Our family are frequent travelers and our two boys (4 and 7) are very flexible and accommodating. However, with all that, we were so pleasantly surprised to find this hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews. Our room was spacious (for European standards), had a king sized bed (I don't think I've seen that in Europe before), had a - for Europe - luxurious bath with a large shower (no tub) and lots of extras. The hotel was very green, which was nice bonus (loved the key by the door driving the room lights feature). The rate was tremendous for the value. We loved walking around the corner and up the block to get to the Metro and Avenue Montparnasse has several dining options and even a few small groceries. A small boutique hotel, it was a great place for us to stay for two nights as we explored such a fascinating city. Next time we go to Paris, this hotel will be on the top of our list of places to stay! Keep in mind that the hotel doesn't provide parking but recommends a garage nearby with a special three day parking rate. However, it's imperative you present the card with the rate before you leave the parking garage to get the rate, which in our case presented a 20 EU savings. Breakfast is available onsite, depending on your room rate it may be an additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Arnonafek
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel, extremely friendly staff, good location, nice room though a bit small, very comfortable bed. Good location, close to Luxembourg Garden, Recommended by all mean A nice restaurant in front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “it just does not get any better than this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: timyolen
Reviews.Content: the best, most accomodating and helpful staff we have experienced in our 40 years of traveling. great rooms, great food, great location and the world's greatest staff. everything about this hotel was special, and i could not have imagined what a wonderful compliment this facility was to the absolute beauty and grandeur of Paris. we will never come to Paris again and NOT stay at Le Six.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: vespahon
Reviews.Content: I went to celebrate my 20 year wedding anniversary, the hotel concierges gave the best service we have ever had. Hotel rooms where excellent. The hotel is a little away from the main attractions, 30min walk, but you have two metro stations near. Will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: acaida
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time at this hotel and in Paris I don't know where to begin. On arrival to the hotel we were greeted warmly and shown directly to our room as an early check in. The room was clean and had a comfy king size bed. We had a room facing the street but had no problem with noise at night or in the morning. Bathroom was great(I'm a real clean freak). Location was very good for dining and for the Metro. Try dinner across the street, very good traditional French food at a good price. Breakfast was good and filling. Had some good breads and cheeses plus more. I can not say enough good things about the staff. We loved them all. Very helpful. Thank you again! We stayed for 10 days here and had no problems. Two nights we were there we had entertainment at the bar/lounge which was nice. Hope to stay again !

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but a noisy stay”
Reviews.Author: Bromley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Six for 4 nights at the end of March for our 30th wedding anniversary. The room was good and clean, the bed was comfortable and there was a very good shower. There was free wi-fi. The hotel is in a good part of Paris, easy access to the tourist areas but not quite as busy or hectic. There are bars and restaurants around. We ate the first night at La Timbre which the hotel recommended and booked for us and we enjoyed. The exchange rate isn't kind to us at the moment and we did find Paris expensive. A glass of wine in the hotel bar was 10 euros - but 5 euros elsewhere. We bought a Paris museum pass which was good value and we found the metro easy (buy a carnet of 10 tickets from the m/c at the station or from the eurostar buffet which works out cheaper). Our room rate included breakfast which was very good - a good range of hot and cold on the buffet and the breakfast service was good. The one downside to our stay was the noise. We had a street facing room on the third floor and there was a lot of noise during the night - people shouting and traffic noise - which kept us awake. Also there was building work taking place in the building next door which disturbed us every morning at 8.30 a.m. A bit early when breakfast is served until 11 a.m. We did mention it to reception a couple of times and again when we checked out. We felt that they didn't really know how to handle a complaint - a shrug of the shoulder wasn't really good enough for us when we had paid 260 euros per night. In our reservation we had asked them to choose a nice room for us for our anniversary and for our first trip to Paris. Unfortunately this didn't seem to work out and we wouldn't return or recommend the hotel to others unless they could guarantee a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great First time Paris Visit at Le Six”
Reviews.Author: jm61285
Reviews.Content: Took our teenageGrandaughter along for our first Paris visit (8 nights) and found this lovely small hotel a perfect solution. The Paris Subway system is superb and easy to use, and really all you need to get around. Le Six is within a 5 minute walk of 4 stations that will get you quickly and safely to any place in town. Hotel is on a quiet side street but very near all the restaurants, shopping, banks and whatever you might need. A couple of blocks from an good observation deck(only tall building in central Paris). Everyone at the hotel spoke great English (we speak almost no French), and was extremely helpful. Do not worry about the language problem when going to Paris but be very careful where you exchange money!! Restaurant directly across the street from Le Six is superb!! Cathedral next door is lovely- go in and look around. Room was large enough for the 3rd person despite generally small rooms in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Dtheresa
Reviews.Content: A very good little hotel. Comfortable, crisp clean sheets. Hotel Le Six has modern amenities and good design. Breakfast selection and room was a good way to start the day. We would have no qualms about recommending this hotel and would happily book a stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Vesna019
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe room located in 5th floor with a street view. The hotel is contemporary with nice rooms and great bathrooms. Staff friendly. Excellent breakfast.Convinient location (good for the Metro). I love a nice and quiet street off of busy Raspaul. I believe that our 5-day trip in Paris and the entire experience were so awesome because of our stay in this Hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Contemporary Boutique Hotel for a short break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Grinders13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a comfortable base for a long weekend in Paris, we used Trip Advisor and found this gem. It is contemporary, wet room bathrooms, flat screen TV, SPA, and a King size bed with nice linen. It is situated in a side street near Montpanasse within a couple of minutes walk of 3 metro stations which gives quick access to all other parts of Paris. We travelled Eurostar and it is 30 minutes from Gare du Nord without having to change lines. Our welcome was perfect. Our room was on the first floor near the lift shaft, but my wife who travels a lot and is a very light sleeper said it was the quietest city central hotel she had ever stayed in. Our room although not large was plenty big enough. It is furnished in contempoary modern style, nice wooden floors, safe, free wi fi and excellent bedside lights (how often is the light so poor it is impossible to read a book in bed at night!). Our rate included the breakfast buffet which was all you could want (unless of course full English is your bag). Staff were very helpful in booking local restaurants. Unfortunately there is a restaurant directly opposite which has an excellent rating on Trip Advisor but was closed the Saturday and Sunday we stayed. Le Six has a nice looking Spa but we just did not have enough time to use it. I would without reservation recommend the Hotel and hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Le Six was pretty sweet.”
Reviews.Author: cdog423
Reviews.Content: So, my review is a little late, because it's been almost a year since I stayed there with my brother. We travelled to France because my brother had some business to take care of in Nantes, and we wanted to see Paris for a few days before flying home. I was the travel agent, and after a couple months of checking out hotels online, I decided on le Six. The stay didn't get off to a very good start. We arrived an hour after check-in started, but had to wait in the lobby for 30 minutes while they finished cleaning the room. After that, we head up to the room to chill out, and after a few minutes a hotel employee and new guest opened the door and came in (they had apparently double-booked our specific room). I imagine that was pretty weird for the other hotel guest, to walk into their room and see 2 lanky dudes laying on their beds with expressions like, 'what in the hell?' Both of those aspects of our stay at le Six were annoying, but not something that ruined our time there. After we got settled in and toughed through those 2 minor issues, the hotel was great. We had free internet and the bathroom was pretty sweet too. In Nantes, we had been staying in a dorm/loft setup that was nice, but not exactly clean/comfortable. So when we got to chill out and sleep on beds that weren't 15 years old and smelly, we certainly took advantage. The staff was very nice and helpful, and we were able to relax for a few nights before heading back home. It's a bit of a walk if you want to head over to the Louvre, or even longer for the Eiffel Tower. That being said, the location is sweet and there's plenty of food, groceries, and fun close by. I definitely enjoyed my time there, and would recommend the hotel to anyone I talked to.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel disguised under four stars”
Reviews.Author: PogiinSF
Reviews.Content: During my travels I have slept from a fisherman's hammock in Canoa Quebrada of northeast Brazil to the Ritz Carlton in Singapore and the Hotel Le Six made me feel priveleged as no other establishment ever has. You are treated like a celebrity and made to feel at home. Any problem? - solved to your satisfaction without hesitation. Chic, stylish, understated, attention to detail, all those elusive qualities every hotel wants Le Six has in abundance. A discreet and excellent location off Blvd Montparnasse puts guests steps from delicious food, little shops, transportation, and all things Paris. The bed was so comfortable with fine linens so sleeping my time away was a tempting option. However, the City of Light beckoned and we were resigned to cherishing our stay at Hotel Le Six as one of the highlights of an incredible holiday.

Reviews.Title: “classy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocochanel68
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel from the moment I stepped inside. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room and bathroom were excellent, so much so that I was just happy spending time in my room, and breakfast was awesome. The coffee was very good and I am particular about my coffee. The hotel is on a quiet side street with 3 metro stops nearby and airport buses are at Montparnasse station which is about a 10 minute walk. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Paris. Le Six is a small, classy hotel without being pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Hotel is Fairly Basic! Would hate to see other lower rated hotels”
Reviews.Author: snifamily
Reviews.Content: Ok, here's the thing, if I hadn't seen that this hotel was rated #4 out of 1844 hotels on trip advisor, and that the Four Season George V was rated #3, I probably would have thought this place was great. It's all about expectations. We were expecting incredible luxury, but it was a little more like a small Marriott in Lincoln, Nebraska....it's nice, but it won't blow you away. The room was very small, but that is to be expected in Paris. The staff were friendly. One of the bar tenders is an Adrian Brody look-a-like. The breakfast wasn't worth 22 Euros, so don't pay that. Just walk a block to a Patisserie and pick up a coffee and croissant for 4 Euros. The hotel was certainly clean, fresh and well maintained. We had a king size bed in a superior room overlooking the street. The TV was big...we ended up watching a lot of BBC World after the Japan Earthquake. The location in fantastic...probably the best part of the hotel. You are 1-2 blocks away from 3 Metro stops (Notre Dame de Champs, Vavin and Montparnasse Bienvenue). It is also about a 5 minute walk from the Port Royal RER (commuter train) stop that will take you to the CDG airport in 45 minutes for 8.70 Euros rather than a 45 minute taxi ride for 55 Euros. The Metro is fantastic. You can be from your hotel room the the Tour Eiffel or Arc de Triomph in 15 minutes. There is no need for a car and no need to waste money on taxis. Don't book this hotel through an online site like hotels.com or expedia. Email the hotel directly and ask for their best rate, and don't be afraid to negotiate. Have fun, Paris is memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, great employees, pleasant all the way around.”
Reviews.Author: Rozbscoob
Reviews.Content: Very clean modern rooms. Nice breakfast. Nothing is a great value as the dollar is losing ground against the euro every day. The room needed a hook to hang a coat or a robe or something! Other than that it was a nice homey small hotel. Just as expected and very well described by everyone else. We stayed at the Sofitel on Rue Cambon last time which was totally different area, so it was nice to stay in a new area. Many nice place to stay in Paris. Had a bar, but no one was ever there!

Reviews.Title: “excellent and well situated”
Reviews.Author: skeptical_9
Reviews.Content: excellent and well situated with great front desk.good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bramhallparis
Reviews.Content: Fantastic and recommended. We visited Paris for our wedding anniversary and received complimentary champagne and macarons! Room was impeccable and staff were very charming. Great location away from the downtown tourist masses but close to 3 different metro stops and walking distance from St Germain/Luxemboug Park/Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “An exemplary hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebennstl
Reviews.Content: We really had a wonderful four-night stay at Hotel Le Six in February during our first visit to Paris. Having booked several months in advance, I was able to secure a greatly reduced rate for a deluxe room, which was located on the fourth floor of the hotel, overlooking the quaint and quiet Rue Stanislas. We have nothing but good things to say about all aspects of Le Six -- the staff was gracious, professional, helpful and friendly; our room was clean, bed was comfortable and the bathroom had modern amenities; the private steam room in the spa downstairs was a nice retreat after a full day of walking around the city; and the location was ideal for getting around either on foot or by Metro. I would recommend Le Six to anyone visiting Paris, and I'd be sure to stay there again on our return.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, well located for a sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: jenx2468
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights at Hotel Le Six. Its located within 5 to 10 minute walk of at least 3 metro stops and is a 20 min metro trip from Gare Du Nord. English is extensively spoken and the relatively young staff are charming and attentive. This is a boutique hotel and the rooms are very clean, well appointed with a very modern feel. The bathroom decor was incredible Our room was timber floored and slightly echoed. The bar and breakfast restaurant are very modern in appearance and the breakfasts are a mix of english and continental. We didn't eat at night in the hotel and the room service prices looked a little expensive. There are lots of cafe bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel. A great boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel.....Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: pamc113
Reviews.Content: Hotel was situated steps away from many unique shops and restaurants that Paris has to offer. Staff was highly professional and very accommodating. Young Gentleman who worked the evening shift was most helpful and friendly.......he is an asset to your establishment. Women who worked the morning shift also helpful and friendly. Houskeeping service was fabulous, clean and modern rooms, highly pleasurable experience. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, go and experience this gem for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: mslynnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, intimate, well-located and every member of the staff is extremely attentive. I would go back in a heartbeat, it is one of the nicest places I have been. Couldn't ask for more! Also, le petit dejeuner was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Tidy”
Reviews.Author: Jimberooney
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six is a well presented boutique hotel located near Montparnasse station. The service was efficient with all staff speaking a high level of English. The breakfast was very good if a little expensive. The only real disadvatage was the proximity to key destinations within Paris, which were accessible via the metro. If this is not important to you then Le Six is an ideal Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THREE WORDS ... FAN TAS TIC !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kingy87
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I have just returned from a Valentines trip from this wonderful hotel. Moulton Brown toileteries, top quality bed linen, spotless rooms and great staff. Can't wait to go back and can't recommend Le Six anymore highly. Should be N01 in Paris. Oh and before we forget ..... thank you for the single red rose placed on our bed for Valentines!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: geordie17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at le Six for one week with my daughter and it was supberb. The staff were excellent, very helpful and went out of their way to make everything a wonderful experience. Our day began with a great breakfast, we were within a short walk of 3 underground train stations and had no trouble reading the transit map. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel in every price range. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and will stay there again. The beds were very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: daphnebubbles
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with very friendly staff. The receptionists were welcoming and helpful and the bar staff very friendly. However, I was a bit disappointed with our room, which was tiny and overlooking the air conditioning and other windows. When I told the bar man that it was my husband's birthday, he invited us back to the bar the following evening for a drink, which was a very nice gesture. I liked the location - it was not the livliest spot but more true to Paris than a lot of other hotels and very convenient for both the metro and cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJDREVER Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Le Six hotel was a perfect choice for our first time in Paris, beautifully presented without being intimidating, lovely staff from reception, through the workmen replacing all the TVs, to the barman - all were polite, friendly and spoke excellent English (great for us first timers) Breakfast was a nice continental selection, serve service in a relaxed little section at ground level, very calm and quiet. Location is good too, right beside several metro stations (notably Notre-Dame des Champs, which we used quite a bit) but close enough that, if you wanted a long stroll, you could pretty much see most of central Paris. Thank you for a great stay, we'll be back to Paris for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six lived up to its reviews. The hotel is easily a 4 star boutique property with great rooms and staff. Rooms were smaller than most cities but more than adequate. The condition of our room was great. Hotel staff are very helpful especially when your French is limited to 10 words. The hotel is on the border of St Germain but close to 2 X Metro stations, which take you quickly to the major attractions in the City. Breakfast was fresh, expansive and very high quality. Nothing better than a fresh baguette. We would definitely stay at Le Six again. Positives: Staff, room condition, comfortable beds, breakfast room, access to transport and restaurants. Negatives: Longer than expected walk to Siene. But it’s a very interesting stroll. TIPS: Visit the street market (close to hotel) Marche Raspail. If you are visiting numerous museums get a Paris Museum Pass. I picked up one at the first museum. You’ll save 2+ hours getting into each museum. Yes wander up to a special entrance … pop in … see the Mona Lisa and leave. Oh don’t be shy and try the snails they are very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “we just loved it”
Reviews.Author: susan186460
Reviews.Content: Wowww, this was a hotel to remeber because everything was very nice. The workers were very good and always got my newspaper and drinks a little expensive but good. We will go back in July again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: DineSaw
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to Paris for my 40th birthday- we stayed at Hotel le Six on a Friday and Saturday. As soon as we arrived the service was excellent, perfect English for us poor french speakers and help whenever we needed it. Granted Paris is a little expensive but this was a treat. The room was everything we needed and beautifully clean. The bar was smart and entertainment great. It is very close to 2 stops on the metro and also the Montparnasse Station. We checked out this hotel on TripAdvisor and we're so glad we did. It was a fantastic hotel and I would wholly recommend it as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hip Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Texian
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Very modern vibe with updated rooms and great bathrooms. Staff helpful and friendly. Good breakfast. Decent location (good for the Metro but not as good if walking to the tourist areas). Nice and quiet street off of busy Raspaul. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, superb staff, awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarbucksTina
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 10 days in Paris over Christmas 2010. We started at Hilton Paris La Defense in the financial district (metro zone 3) for 5 days for business, then moved to Hotel Le Six in central Paris (metro zone 1) for 5 days of vacation. As we had heavy suitcases to manoeuvre in messy weather, we took a cab from La Defense (suburb west of Paris) to Hotel Le Six in Montparnasse district. A very wise decision. Upon arrival, the front desk angel helped take our luggage into the hotel, quickly checked us in and took us to our Deluxe room (#403). Our room looked exactly like the website gallery photos: large bathroom with a deep spa tub with glassed shower, comfortable king bed. The room had a desk nook area and 2 large windows. There were lots of areas to stash our luggage. The hotel has beautiful old world character, yet is absolutely modern (including free in-room WiFi). Hotel Le Six is on a quiet one-way side street, but just a block from a major boulevard loaded with shops and restaurants. The only “noise” we heard was the symphony of bells on Christmas Eve from the nearby church, and the daily garbage trucks. It is located within 2 blocks of 3 metro stations: Notre-Dame-des-Champs (metro 12), Vavin (metro 4) and Montparnasse-Bienvenue (metros 4, 6, 12, 13). Each and every one of the personnel was helpful, polite, professional, friendly and eager to please. We rarely saw any other guests (the hotel was less than half full). We felt like Ander was our personal concierge/bartender for the entire 5 nights we stayed (does he live there?). At his suggestion, we dined at Alcazar (Christmas Eve), La Rotunda and went for authentic French crepes at La Creperie de Josselin. Great choices! We also “found” Léon de Bruxelles Montparnasse and our beloved Starbucks within 2 blocks and frequented both. We enjoyed a continental breakfast every day in their spotless eating area. We would highly recommend this hotel for its quality and location. We’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: Wimsey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six is a nice boutique hotel within walking distance of Gare Montparnasse. It is on a quiet side street in a busy part of Paris. The lobby is a bit underwhelming, but the service at check in was great and my room was upgraded to a suite, so that is always nice. The room was spacious and well furnished. It was on the top floor and had a lot of exposed beams and exposed brick which made me think of an old Parisian artist's garrett. The staff were very helpful especially as there was a refienery strike on at the time, and it was a bit difficult to get around the city. They also made some excellent restaurant recommendations. It isn't a fancy 5 star hotel with concierge and bell hops, but it was a great spot to stay when exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: dipsy28
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 2 nights, and they could have not done more. staffed by young enthusiastic and helpful staff. all spoke english. room was beautiful, and nice touches with a letter from manager on check out and nougat on pillow. i was particulary impressed with the small attention to detail - on check out a new person was starting and he made a mistake so the supervisor explained to us, then spoke to trainee and then explained what had been said - one of the best we have stayed in. centrally positioned with great little restaurant opposite next time in paris will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the corner!”
Reviews.Author: RamaDrama
Reviews.Content: A unique boutique hotel. It was perfect for our budget and the service was great. We would like to thank Ander for his recommendations of restaurant and places to see and also making coffee for us on the day we left!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!”
Reviews.Author: keiisser
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service; perfect location (within proximity to metro stations where a train ride to the city center is under 10 min.); rooms are cozy and authentically boutique; staff is extraordinarily friendly, professional and accommodating. This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel, and it has remained consistent. Free WIFI is always a plus which the hotel offers. Simply a pleasure staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgonsar
Reviews.Content: Great and accommodating staff. Rooms and hotel were clean and trendy. Great (and safe) neighborhood. Free wifi too! This was my 4th time in Paris and I'd def come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: neatnik66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Six for 2 weeks. We researched extensively before we left and were very pleased we chose this hotel. It is clean, fresh and well maintained. Initially, I was a bit hesitant about booking because of the hotel's willingness to accommodate some pets (this didn't strike me as being particularly hygienic), but it was very clean. Every staff member is cheerful and friendly and went the extra mile at every turn. The rooms, though quite small are very nice. Perhaps a selection of in-house movies could have been offered. The breakfasts are buffet-style with plenty of choice. The location couldn't be better, very close to two metro stops and in the nicest area of Paris, and within walking distance of the centre of Paris. We had the internet special deal of 209 Euros per night for a Classique room (including breakfast). We'd recommend a room with a street view - from what we could tell the courtyard view wasn't as good. We loved the live music they had in the little bar area on occasion too! Hotel Le Six was a lovely mix of quaint and modern. They deserve there 'Hotels of Distinction' high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in! Pure luxury.”
Reviews.Author: interdream
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December for my girlfriends birthday and from the minute we first walked through the door we were impressed. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and welcoming (and they all speak fluent English) and the lobby was very nicely decorated and clean, it even smelled luxurious. We were shown to our room on the 6th floor, and were stunned by the size and quality of everything! Having read other reviews complaining about the size of standard rooms, the deluxe room which we stayed in was more than big enough, with a king size bed and luggage there was still plenty of room to manouvre. The bathroom is great, with a large bath and walk-in shower, complete with expensive Molton Brown toiletries. Everything was spotlessly clean. The breakfast at the hotel is extremely good, although expensive. We had managed to find a deal online that included breakfast at a reduced rate. The breakfast room downstairs is light and spacious, and the food itself is wonderful. One morning we requested that our breakfast be brought to our room, and it arrived bang on time, exactly as ordered. The bar is excellent, although incredibly expensive, and the bartender was very friendly and helpful. We casually mentioned one evening that we weren't sure what to do tomorrow and he grabbed a map and showed us some great locations to go visit. He also got the concierge to book us a table at a really nice restaurant, which turned out to be better than any of the ones we had picked ourselves! We even got a couple of drinks for free as it was a special occasion. The location is good - it's very quiet and just off Montparnasse Boulevard. You can get all over Paris on just one metro train. Overall we had a really relaxing, luxurious stay, made even better by the ultra friendly and helpful staff. We would love to return soon, and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fab mix of value, location and luxury”
Reviews.Author: AVOIDCHELSEAHOTEL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - really clean, very close to three metro stations, (Notre dame des Champs, Vavin and Montparnasse Bienvenue) one of which, Vavin, has a line going straight to Gare du Nord (for me), and (I'm almost sure) a direct line to Charles de Gaulle airport (For my friend). Friendly staff, (perhaps a LITTLE tired at breakfast!) and lovely room. Only slight downside was that air conditioning unit whistled in the bathroom at night, keeping my friend awake. (I was too tired to notice it much). Definitely recommend this hotel, if you book well in advance you may get a good internet deal.

Reviews.Title: “good base for exploration”
Reviews.Author: sacrifice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Six for four days and it's a great hotel to stay at: great rooms, great location and great staff. The only consideration is that they claim to have room service (absolutely nothing vegetarian and not flexibility on altering menu); they claim to have a bar but really its if the front desk staff aren't busy and they don't know how to make the cocktails. So if you're looking for a great, clean, comfortable and well located hotel room - BOOK now. If you're expecting the added extra's of a bigger hotel think further.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Exceptional Staff, Incredible Quality, L O V E IT!”
Reviews.Author: christhomson1988
Reviews.Content: Where do I start about this one...??? Well I think firstly it's worth saying that prior to our visit I contact the hotel a few times via e-mail and they were very quick to reply which was great. The hotel lobby is very welcoming and extremely well presented. The staff were very helpful as soon as we arrived. The staff do speak excellent English! I speak French, however my girlfriend doesn't and she had no problems in communication with the staff. The rooms are lovely, very nice and modern, the bathrooms are great with amazing showers and kitted out with some fantastic stuff. Excellent Melton Brown toiletries!!! The beds are very comfortable and and clean. The only problem we had in the whole stay was that the first morning we were woken up by the next door neighbours doing some DIY work against the wall we shared with them. This was not something the hotel could control, but they did everything they could to sort the situation out for us. The manager went round first to find out what was going on, however he could not pursuade them to stop, so we were moved into another room, it turned out it was an upgraded room because that's all there was. The speed and understanding of the staff was fantastic and we were swiftly moved rooms. Even though we were at the hotel for only three nights I felt like I had built a raport with the staff and they were very approachable and understanding of any needs. They were happy to book us a taxi to a restaurant and happy to place reservations at a restaurant too. The hotel's location is perfect. In a quiet street so you don't have to worry about people making noise at night, however just walk up the street 30 seconds and you are on Boulevard Montparnasse which has lots of restaurants and shops on etc. There is a pharmacy about 60 seconds away down the road, and two Metro stops about a minute away. One of the Metro stations, Vavin, is on Line 4 which is the same line Gare Du Nord is on...so if you're coming on Eurostar, like we did, then transport connections are perfect! The other station Notre Dame des Champs is on another great line to be on! I went through tripadvisor for hours trying to find the best hotel that wasn't like £500 a night. So let me save you all the trouble and just tell you to book up here...u wont regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller5
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I loved my stay here. This was my first time in Paris and was only here to pick up my visa to Mauritania for a business trip. I loked this place up in Traveladvisor and it was a winner! from the moment I made a booking online, they contacted me by email and confirmed my booking. Eveyone is friendly, and unlike what other people think of the French, they were most accommodating and they spoke better English than my French. The man at the front desk even offered to translate the menu from the restaurant across the road. I recommend checking out the restaurant across the lane. Quaint and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Flix211
Reviews.Content: We already had high expectations about this hotel from other reviews here at tripadvisor, but we were still amazed that everything is true or even better. The most effective and very pleasant staff, beautiful room, high-quality bed, quiet sleep and excellent breakfast, what more one can wish on the trip to Paris? The hotel location is great, plenty of restaurants in walking distance, subway practically in front of the hotel, but still the hotel is hidden in the side street and with good windows its rooms are very quiet. Breakfast was also superb, e.g. the wide choice of excellent juices is unusual. However, our best experience remains with the hotel staff - everyone was always nice and ready to help, and all our requests were promptly fulfilled. We can really recommend this hotel to anyone, you will not regret...

Reviews.Title: “Started ok...transitioned to very good (for a price!)”
Reviews.Author: lbh2315
Reviews.Content: My original room was a superior on the 1st floor. Upon opening the door, disappointment set in. The fact that this room was $388/night was nauseating. Yes, it was clean and nice. But it was a bed and a bathroom. Not much more - for almost $400/night without breakfast. In addition, we could hear the room above us, the rooms around us and the people coming and going from the lobby. In a word, not even worth $200/night for that room. Simply stated, it was a major disappointment and I was frustrated thinking about staying in that room for $1,200 for three nights. Needless to say, I barely slept the first night. Now for the transition.....asked if a bigger room was available and the wonderful staff upgraded us for 75 euro per night. The suite was a completely different story! Top floor, no noise and TONS of space for a Parisian hotel. A sitting room with a desk, a chair, sofa and coffee table. A HUGE shower and bath and a separate toilet area with a second sink. Separate bedroom with king bed and lots of storage. Great Molton Brown products, big picture windows with views and two TVs. Now this is what I was expecting from the reviews. This room was perfect. Slept like a baby, loved the space. The staff was just wonderful. Brought coffee to the room for us at no additional charge. Helped with restaurant reservations. Always spoke perfect English. Helped with Taxi to CDG and even send up pastries and coffee upon our early morning departure. Every person in the staff always said hello and offered to help with anything. Wi-fi worked great. Overall, a great place to stay...if you can get a suite. A couple of final observations. First, beware that the rooms have hardwood floors. As someone who lived in lofts in Chicago, I knew this was a bad idea! Of course you can hear every step of the people above you - meaning if they are up at 2am, so are you. Second, breakfast is 22 euro and that is a big disappointment when you are paying $400-$600 per night for a room. I have stayed a countless luxury hotels throughout the world and this is one of the select few that does not include breakfast - even when staying in a suite. Third, make sure you are ok with public transit - I have been to Paris many times so taking the Metro everywhere is not a problem, but for first time visitors I would suggest a hotel on the river and closer to the usual first time visitor sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: UriW
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: almost all interesting places are within one train. Walking distance from st. Jermain and Luxembourg Gardens. Small quiet hotel, very nice room and bath. Most confortabkle bed I had in a hotel anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: kotoole
Reviews.Content: We are new parents travelling with a 5 month old. The staff are friendly, accommodating & fantastic (particularly the staff at reception). The hotel is modern. The room clean & comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! So nice to meet with pleasant staff - they deserve a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “They Saved Us!!”
Reviews.Author: EFDef
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how grateful I am of the quality of service my husband and I received from this hotel. This staff took care of us before and after our stay with them. The front desk team was exceptional, and we felt a warm welcome coming into their hotel. My husband and I had to find another hotel to stay at quickly as our other vacation rental had an emergency flooding. So we walked into Le Six about 10:30am. They were quick to let us know that they could keep our luggage, and they would have the room available as soon as possible. Unfortunately, I can't remember everyone's name, but the beautiful young blonde, and the young gentleman with the glasses were the first we met. They were great and accommodating to us, and let us bumble our brand new French words we had just learned a couple of days ago:) Then it only gets better!! We were only to stay at Le Six for a couple of days as we were supposed to catch a train to Spain. But our train was canceled and so we decided that maybe we could stay at Le Six again, until our next train departure. We went to the hotel, and the hotel was full. My husband and I quickly found out that almost all hotels in Paris were full, especially the ones in our price range. I was just beginning to freak out, when Jan appeared with his magical smile, and said he just had someone leave, and they would clean the room quickly for us to stay with them. This is about 9:00pm. He invited us to have a drink at the bar, and he would let us know when it was ready. That's when we were enchanted by Alex the bartender. He was such a great conversationalist, and my husband and both enjoyed speaking with him...Jan came over and asked what we were going to do for the rest of our time, since our train wasn't going to be leaving for a couple more days. I told him I was going to keep looking tonight online, and hopefully we will find something available. By the morning, they had already found us another hotel near by, and had booked us those nights!!! I was amazed by their willing to help us over and beyond what most hotel staff would do for their customers! Special thanks to Jan, and the rest of the Front desk staff, and a special shout out to Alex! We will definitely make our plans way ahead of time to make sure we stay at this wonderful hotel where the staff knows how to give first class treatment to ALL of their customers! Thanks again, Elischa and Larc

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Marilisa_Lanave
Reviews.Content: We picked Le Six after reading all the positive reviews on this website. It was our first time in Paris and we wanted it to be special. We didn't want to stay too far from the monuments and the museums but we wanted to stay in a nice neighbourhood, close to nice restaurants and bars frequented by Parisians and not just toursits' traps. The hotel is perfect, the neighbourhood is charming and we had a great time in the evening visting all the places suggested to us by Martin, one of the receptionists. The customer service in this hotel is outstanding. If you book it you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: cswrites
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one week and cannot say enough good things about its style, its cleanliness, its great staff, it excellent location and the comfort and size of the room and bathroom (for Paris). I put it on par with a W-Hotel in terms of style and comfort (fewer ammenities though) at half the price and "attitude" ;-). I was at the hotel on my birthday and they even sent up a bottle of nice champagne on the house. Very close to Luxembourg Gardens via rue Vavin--which is a quaint shopping street (nice chocolate vendors, clothing boutiques), at the crossroads of Montparnesse and Pres St. Germain which are wall to wall with restaurants and shops. Rue Stanislas is quiet for this location with no late night venues on the block. I walked EVERYWHERE from here, but transit was very close at hand on either Blvd Raspail or Blvd Montparnesse. A nice sized bar fridge made it possible to keep a few nibblies at hand too. Molten Brown toiletries were lovely (bring hair conditioner though), a good hair dryer also a safe and an ironing board and iron in the closet. I will recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Paris and hope the hotel enjoys much well-deserved success.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: besterCY
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our honeymoon in probably the most romantic city in the world, Paris!!! After deciding the destination, a hotel is needed. We were looking for a hotel that is quiet, elegant, comfortable, cozy, romantic, beautiful a hidden gem. After a lot of searching and reading reviews we ended up in Hotel Le Six. A small boutique hotel on the left bank of Paris. The service was excellent and the staff very friendly. The room was OK not to big and not to small for a boutique hotel. We stayed in a deluxe room. It has free WiFi. The hotel is in a quite street, very close to Montparnasse metro station. Which made very easy sightseeing Paris. We spend an unforgettable honeymoon thanks to Hotel Le Six!!! We definitely going to visit it again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff - modern!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess77
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Friday night. The receptionist was super friendly and checked us in quickly. Once we got to the room, we noticed 6 complimentary pasteries. The room was a good size, clean, and was very modern. The hotel is a great location with loads of restaurants and cafes just steps away. There are 2 metro stations just a few minutes walk from the hotel. All the staff were so friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Luxury Hotel with top service”
Reviews.Author: ViajaLA
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel I found through Splendia and Splendid it was! The hotel is clean and has lots of modern amenities. We were upgraded to a Deluxe room and it was a very large room, especially for European standards. The bathroom was modern and huge and had beautiful teak floors. The towel warmer, rainforest shower and speedy internet service were great benefits. The room was super quiet and the bed very comfortable. We only wish we had more time there! The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. They made several restaurant recommendations (the one we took was excellent) and very accommodating to all of our requests and needs. Our friends stayed at Le Meridien and the staff there were rude and impersonal. At Le Six we felt extremely welcomed and can't wait to go back. HIghly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful customer service!”
Reviews.Author: blondie154914
Reviews.Content: We were greeted afer a LONG 10hr+ flight, by front desk staff that told us our room was not ready- and WE had flown ALL night - so very desperate to shower, sleep etc. after, we stressed our dismay- They quickly, came up with a room and from here, we received excellent customer service, friendly, efficient, and courteous! The room is small (paris standard- normal) but, the room is clean, modern, bright, and the bathroom is wonderful with a large, modern, tile shower. Since, the hotel is a boutique we appreciated the cozy atmosphere. The location is close to the tulleries park which we enjoyed for AM runs, but a fair distance to all the tourist sights etc. IF you enjoy walking, great location, if you need to be close to all tourist sights- you must be prepared to walk, bus, or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough!”
Reviews.Author: stevefaz
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. We were there in early October 2010 for one night after a trip through Provence. The hotel staff was EXCELLENT. From meeting us outside their door to help us with our luggage to helping us make dinner reservations at a perfect restaurant. They also responded very quickly to several e-mail before our arrival. While we were there for only one night, they treated us like permanent residents. Our first floor room was excellent. Clean, modern, and surprisingly quiet. It was so quiet, we felt like we were still in the French countryside. I've posted pictures. They speak for themselves. Thank you Hotel Le Six for a wonderful stay! You're our address in Paris from now on! Oh.... one more thing... your wireless internet service was excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEMChicago
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is top notch. All staff speak English and are very helpful, friendly and professional. The room we were in was small (but that's Paris) but we had a full sized, fully enclosed shower (very rare in Europe) and the mattress was very comfortable. Our room was facing the street and, in general, it was very quiet. The hotel is just a couple blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens an 1/2 block from a metro station. Great hotel--we couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Left Bank Hotel with extremely knowledgable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ddebellis83
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel! Everything was very clean, new and well kept. The staff is extremely helpful, all are multilingual and understand the importance of catering to the specific needs of each individual. You will not feel rushed or insignificant, in this hotel everyone feels like a VIP. Upon arrival to Le Six, I was greeted by the hotel manager, asked about my flight, how I found the transfer to the hotel and if I would like any beverages. Check in was smooth and effortless, less than 5 minutes. Our room was ready upon arrival at 11AM despite normal check in time being 2PM. The Standard room was spacious with all the amenities that one would need. Molton Brown bath amenities, always a lovely treat! Iron & ironing board, ample closet space, In-room mini bar & safe and spacious, modern bathroom (with stand up shower/no tub - that being the reason I only gave 4 of 5 on the room rating). The breakfast was tasty - included cold cereal, yogurts, a variety of fresh croissants and breads, fresh fruit and freshly squeezed juices. Le Six has a lovely spa. A wonderful hidden gem in Paris! Turkish baths in the spa make this boutique hotel truly unique. Also located in the hotel, is a cozy lounge/bar area to rendezvous for an afternoon espresso or an evening drink! Fun fact: in the lounge, Le Six displays artwork from various local artists; they change these displays every 3-4 weeks. I was lucky to see two very different styles displayed during my stay, and I must say it definitely adds character to this hotel! There is a small business center located on the main floor - there is only 1 computer however…5 Euro for 15 minutes and 7 Euro for 30 minutes. WiFi access is available throughout the hotel as well. The staff: all members of the staff, from housekeeping to the GM, are there to make sure your stay is as smooth and stress-free as possible. Their recommendations are 100% on par for anything you are looking for, and will not send you anywhere you will dislike. Le Six is also very conveniently located near multiple metro stations, which makes for an easy and affordable way to move around the city. Overall, the only complaint I have is that I could not stay longer. I will definitely recommend Le Six to friends, family and colleagues and they will definitely have me stay with them on my future trips to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Style and luxury in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Conferencer
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here with my wife on our first visit to Paris (having spent 5 nights in another great hotel nearby which couldn't accommodate us for the full 10 days). Our luxury treat in a Junior Suite on the top floor. A premium price (at the peak of the season) gave us a premium room, a king bed and impeccable service. Spacious, very quiet, chic decor and a massive bathroom with walk-in shower with great pressure, heated towel rails (with electronic timer and variable heat settings); large storage space, included iron and ironing board (whatever that is - my wife seemed to know), spacious safe, separate toilet, separate tea/coffee making. A view over spacious stylish apartments with gardens and a small viewing terrace. Very comfortable king-size bed and pillows. Good wi-fi access included in rate. Didn't try the restaurant here although it seemed very smart: we were happy to sit at a local cafe for a "formule" fixed-price breakfast and people-watching. Service was very pleasant and helpful - bilingual staff. Many advantages: this is not a large impersonal "chain hotel" - it is discrete and stylish. Placed perfectly for shopping and sight-seeing: the Vavin metro stop a couple of blocks away gives great access to the key north-south axis of the No. 4 line (including Montmartre, Sacre Coeur, Gare du Nord, Ile de la Cite, the Left Bank) and easy cross-over to all the other key metro lines. A short stroll to the exquisite Jardin du Luxembourg, a second metro line (No. 12 - Notre Dame des Champs) just down the street. Plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants - the best of which is the superb little Le Timbre restaurant a couple of blocks away. The hotel is close enough to quickly access all the key tourist areas but feels sufficiently removed from the hustle and bustle. Highly recommended if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zlani
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for the weekend and booked us into this hotel after reading rave reviews on Trip Advisor. He made a fantastic choice! Location is great; very close to 2 metros and the beautiful Luxembourg gardens and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel is small and boutique, beautifully furnished with a cute bar, restaurant and spa. Hotel staff were unbelievably helpful, bedrooms were lovely and the power shower was fab! It's tucked away off a side street, so it's very quiet and I slept like a log both nights! I would thoroughly recommend to stay in this hotel whilst in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff! Très agréable”
Reviews.Author: T-oon-ces-1234
Reviews.Content: The staff at this little boutique hotel made our stay! They were so helpful with providing us directions, suggestions for restaurants or just offering us coffee before an early morning departure for the airport. The rooms were a little small but they used their space well also the bathroom was very nice and modern. Even thought the rooms were small you didn't hear your neighbors or outside noise. The train station, metro, and bus lines are close by. I enjoyed our stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James2559
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris on my way to Singapore. Stayed 2 nights at Le Hotel Six July 28/29th. after doing extensive homework and looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor this looked like the place for me. Location was great, (Next to Luxemberg Park) on a quite side street but close to all the attractions, cafes and restaurants. Subway was just down the street and made sightseeing very easy. Staff were exceptional from the front desk, to the restaurant staff at breakfast. All were very helpful during my visit. (providing recommendations, directions and even via email correspdondence prior to arriving). I requested a room that faced the the side street which provided floor to ceiling windows that opend to a small balcony. Hotel rooms are as pictured...very modern, upscale and spotless. Rooms are not huge, but were more then enough. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but way overpriced, and too far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: KarenLen
Reviews.Content: After spending a few of our 5 nights here we realised that at 350 Euros a night there were much better choices closer to tourist action and hot spots. This hotel is too far away and in a poor location. The prices are not justified. To their credit the management decided to throw in breakfast and reduce the rate slightly to keep us here -but it put a total damper on our Paris holiday knowing we paid too much and ended up so far out.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and great bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: sarahchoi
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable and the room was small but had everything we needed. The bathroom was lovely with a rainfall shower head that was totally luxurious. The concierge found the restaurant we were looking for and booked reservations and mapped it out. The hotel location was great on the left bank, walking distance to the Metro and tons of shopping. I would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: decandt
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our London/Paris trip yesterday and we already miss Paris and this hotel. Our room looked just like the pics...we had room #503. Big beautiful king size bed and equally beautiful bathroom (those were at the top of our list of importance in a hotel). We did not have the breakfast, it is pricey and there are too many great cafe's within a few blocks for half the price. The staff were amazing, even at 5 am when my girlfriend and I stumbled in after a very long day/night of drinking...husbands made us climb the Effil tower the next day (we paid dearly)! Highly recommend this hotel and have a feeling we will be back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...value for money in Paris...amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: notpatsy74
Reviews.Content: This nicely-located hotel is clean, modern and stylish, serving a lovely breakfast far superior to most in Paris, and the hotel staff are friendly and eager to please. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay again without hesitation. Such a pleasant surprise :)

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Wonderful Breakfast!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susie60768
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive things about the service of the staff. To give you an example I accidentally created a small flood in our room. My husband and I came back to our room after being gone all day to a small layer of water all over our bathroom floor. The staff immediately responded, investigated and I determined it had been my fault. They were nice enough not to blame me and put us in a better room with a bottle of champagne and strawberries, even though, it was not their fault. They were all very, very professional. The rooms are not huge but very, very nice and modern. The breakfast was among the best I have ever had. It offered almost everything you could imagine. The location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, beautifully appointed, great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: harpenden_9
Reviews.Content: As good as other reviews suggest. Rooms aren't enormous, but are to a very high spec and are clearly laid out to maximise room and to feel spacious. Very close to 3 metro stations on 3 different lines and there's good bars/ restaurants just around the corner. It's on a nice side street, so no traffic noise etc. at night. We got a great deal on web for breakfast which is well worth it if you can get it at a good rate- really nice range of food in lovely setting and given the price of food more generally in Paris a complete bargain. I think you'd struggle to find a credible complaint against this hotel- it's chic, comfortable, quiet, well connected and extremely welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_PA73
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but ask about breakfast first. I thought it was included but found out half-way into a one-week stay that it was 22 EUR per person! Yikes! Staff was very friendly. No one begrudged speaking English and they even tolerated my butchered attempts at French with a friendly smile. My son (age 11) was welcomed. We would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: burnsto
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, very central location, walkable to major attractions, near metro stop. Jardins de Luxembourg nearby was lovely. Boulevard de Montparnasse had a load of restaurants. Room was ok price, not an incredible deal. Massage treatments were pretty expensive. The room itself was quiet, no late disturbances. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in Paris - Parfait!!”
Reviews.Author: Pilot-Toronto123
Reviews.Content: We would highly, highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to find a great boutique hotel in Paris. The rooms were beautiful & extremely modern in design & very clean! Although, as other reviewers have mentioned they are not super large, they are beyond comfortable and more than enough space. We looked forward to coming back to our hotel every day & enjoyed the service of the staff (we spoke some French to them, but they were all able to converse in English when necessary. They gave us great recommendations & assistance at all times required. Lobby & sitting areas were super fashionable & trendy, deco was fabulous on all counts. Loved, loved loved the spa-like washrooms & could have showered in there forever, with the amazing Molten Brown bath products. We found the area to be extremely convenient, we took the subway (Montparnesse station) to most destinations as it is super easy in Paris, and we were able to avoid the high costs of taxis, which we only took a couple of times. There are lots of great places to eat in the area & St.Germain de Pres neighbourhoods was one of our favourite places in all of Paris (within easy walking distance), for restaurants and little shops. You must also visit Laduree for their exquisite macarons, and to see their beautiful shop! Indiana resto nearby was great for typical American fare, Le Christine (although was full of tourists) was delicious French food, and a beautiful restaurant. Crepes on the street closeby were a delicious quick snack or lunch. Had great pizza everywhere, and Alberto's nearby looked particularly delicious although we never made it there! Hotel le Six is amazing, and if you are considering this hotel, I highly recommend that you book it, you will not be sorry, was perfect for our honeymoon in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zerophive
Reviews.Content: Located in the 6th arrondissement the Le Six Hotel was my little hotel for 6 days in Paris. From the entrance to the greeting from the staff to the room I stayed in, I was very happy and satisfied with my stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful with my getting around Paris for the first time. The little pocket map they have was the most useful item I had my whole trip. When the rain poured and poured on Bastille Day, they had umbrellas available for the guests. It was a nice touch that made my life much more comfortable. The rooms are small, I took a Deluxe Room with desk. It was small and there was barely enough room to move around, but the room itself was elegantly decorated. The bed was comfortable and I slept very well each night. The bathroom was wonderful, large, with a nice shower and lots of hot water. The complementary english bath products were a nice touch and very welcome wary traveller at the end of a long day or touring. Everything was kept tip top clean, the room had a turndown serviced that placed a nice candy on the pillows every night. On the day of my checkout, they kept my bags and arranged for a taxi to quickly take me to CDG and end my trip. Merçi Le Six for making my Paris stay that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommended in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fingerfood
Reviews.Content: To Paris standards this hotel cannot be recommended enough. The rooms are very comfortable - as are the beds - and the young staff is very friendly. The location is perfect for visiting Paris since the metro-entrance is around the corner. All the good things other travelers write about this hotel is true.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Delight”
Reviews.Author: zimmerrush
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our Honeymoon in Paris and Hotel Le Six. The hotel is in a great part of town, 1 minute from the metro. The whole hotel staff is top notch and always willing to help, but ask the bartender for additional info! We recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Paris. Thank you Le Six for the memories:)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Le Six”
Reviews.Author: PETE095
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break at the Le Six Hotel. I can congratulate the hotel for their very high standards and service. It was a pleasurable stay,the hotel was modern and had lots of little special features that makes it extra special. The location was perfect,street cafes 2 minutes away and yet the hotels location was quiet and peaceful. It was a pleasant 30 minute walk to the river attractions or you could go by Metro. Thankyou Le Six for a enjoyable break.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CBGL2008
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a quiet little side street we both really enjoyed Le Six, it of course helped being upgraded to a suite. For Paris the room size has to be considered enormous, big showers and excellent toileteries. The staff were always very pleasant and welcoming and we would definately return again. Eating in the area was a little disappointing and not cheap. Having previously stayed around the area of L'Opera which has excellent restaurants, those we visited in this very touristy area of Paris were disappointing both in menu choice and availability. Maybe we were just unlucky but you may find you have to do more investigation into the good restaurants than we did - usually in France you do not have to walk far to find good food. Excellent location for the metro and we able to get around the city with ease and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: tommytubbs
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel made our stay enjoyable beyond expectation. Their wonderful breakfast will give you the energy you need to explore this gorgeous region of Paris. There are many great cafes, restaurants, shopping areas, museums, and parks within easy walking distance. Very nice rooms and a quiet location make for a relaxing and refreshing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Petis and modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WelshWAG
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris a few times before and have done the major sights so this was just meant to be a nice relaxing trip for us. We really love the Latin Quarter so that was the major pull for choosing this place. The driver struggled to find the hotel at first but we were pleased with the hotel when we finally arrived. This place does exactly what it says on the tin. It is in a good location and there are lots of good places to eat, drink and just hang out, just a short walk away. If expensive food is your thing then I can reccommend Helene Darrose's Gastronomic restaurant, which is a ten minute walk from the hotel. If you want to venture a little further into town, try La Maison Blanche with it's fantastic views over the City or Laurent Restaurant, which is very romantic. If it's something more down to earth that you are looking for, La Closerie des Lilas is very nice and only a short walk from the hotel or try the wonderful La Fermette Marbeuf, just off the Champs Elysee, but ask for a table in the back room with it's fabulous Art Deco interior. Sorry, I forgot that this was a hotel review. This hotel is good value, we upgraded to an executive room which didn't break the bank and was pretty spacious for Paris standards. Ladies, this place has nice Molton Brown toiletries but NO conditioner, so make sure you pack one or there is a pharmacy just round the corner. The rooms have everything that you would need from your stay and I liked that they had free wireless in the rooms for the duration of our stay. Front of house are very nice and helpful. Restaurant reccommendations were good on the whole but one night they sent us a place behind Notre Dame and within a few minutes I saw a large group of Americans who were also at our hotel strolling in. I think they must have been sent from the same guy...commission? If you want to stay closer to Saint Germain then have a look at Hotel Le Senat, which was a little closer to the action. If it's romance you're going for then Renaissance Paris Hotel Le Parc might be for you, but it's the opposite side of town. Overall this hotel was a great little base for our trip to Paris. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is exceptional in nearly every way”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffourPA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Paris. We traveled with two children so our hotel options were limited. Most hotels didn't allow four to a room. This hotel is highly rated on TripAdvisor.com and for very good reason. I studied for hours looking for a hotel and read so many reviews about small, unclean rooms. Not here. We stayed in a suite on the 5th floor (actually 6th floor, but they call the first floor 0) and it was very large with a king bed in the master bedroom and a pull out sofa for the kids, huge bathroom with the best shower. Everything is very modern and trendy. The photos on their web site looked good, but being there is better. The room was very clean. The lobby was spotless. We found the staff very helpful. Everyone spoke english. Everyone was very friendly. The downside for us was simply location. Some people would love the location because it is near Montparnasse Blvd, which is full or restaurants. Rue de Rennes is around the corner, which is a great shopping area. However, we wanted to wander around and do the typical tourist stuff and this was not ideal walking distance from any where. Nothing was less than a 30 minute walk. At first it wasn't a problem, but after a few days it started to impact us. The good news is that the Metro is just around the corner and easy to use. At night, less traffic, taxis were reasonable. From the Eiffel tower to the hotel was about $10 euros in a cab. If you go to Paris I highly recommend this hotel. Also, make sure you go to the Latin Quarter (rue mouffetard), it is a wonderful area. Great market on the weekends, which is really good for experiencing the culture.

Reviews.Title: “An air of sophistication mixed with warmth!”
Reviews.Author: Artiste75
Reviews.Content: All of our needs were met with complete satisfaction during our stay at Le Six. We highly recommend this lovely hotel in the heart of Paris beginning with it's friendly, helpful staff to a most comfortable bed for restful nights and fresh, with creative breakfasts each morning! The management's attention to detail is most apparent and whether one is staying for business or pleasure they will not be disappointed. Our room size was petite, but this hotel is very grande in all other ways. We appreciated the artwork displayed as well! We hope to return soon for another enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not the cheapest, but certainly worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: gilaandy
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time looking for a hotel for our trip to Paris, largely relying on reviews on Trip Advisor. This was the first time we stayed with them and it definitely will not be our last. Yes, they are not the cheapest (we paid ~£700 for four nights), but they were, in our opinion, definitely worth the extra money. We got a better deal directly through the hotel website (the same price but without breakfast on many travel sites). On arrival the staff were pleasant and courteous and we were quickly checked-in and shown to our room.
