Our shamefully poor command of the French language meant we had to converse in English, but this was no worry - every member of staff spoke excellent English. We were allocated a room on the first floor overlooking Rue Stanislas, with the double-glazed French window opening onto a very small balcony. The bed was very, very comfortable, the pillows just right and the modern, quiet aircon allowed us to adjust the temperature if we needed. The bathroom was very clean and the drench shower was a God-send after long days walking round Paris. There was no bath, but we were fine with that. The standard of housekeeping was excellent. Sheets were turned down of an evening and toiletries replenished (of course, being Molton Brown, these went down very well indeed). A couple of bathrobes were a bonus. One slight downside was the lack of English TV channels (news only I'm afraid), but then who goes to Paris to watch TV?!?!?!? Our room rate included the buffet breakfast, which for a small boutique hotel was quite extensive. Lots of cereals, pastries, hams, cheeses and even bacon & egg on offer. The service was excellent - very prompt. In terms of location, we were looking for a hotel in the Latin Quarter, so this really fit the bill! It's nothing but a short stroll from the Notre-dame des-Champs (Line 12) and Montparnasse Bienvenue (Lines 4, 6, 12 and 13). The short walk to Notre-dame des-Champs station gets you to the Place de la Concorde (ideal for the Louvre) and Abbesses (for the Sacre Coeur), whereas the walk to Montparnasse Bienvenue for the Line 6 will take you to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. Admittedly, the walk for the Line 6 is a little longer (perhaps 5-minutes), but this was a small price to pay! Also on the location front, there's a Monoprix supermarket within a 5-minute walk opposite Gare de Montparnasse; go here if you don't want to pay a fortune for mineral water (one Euro for 3 litres of Volvic!). There's no shortage of reasonably priced, good quality eateries in the area. We paid about twenty Euros each for a main course and an alcoholic drink (diet Coke is actually more expensive than alcohol). Arriving and departing: According to one of the delightful ladies on reception at the Hotel, the price of a taxi is between 50 and 80 Euros to CDG airport, so think hard about that option! We took the RER Line B into the City (about 9 Euros each), but decided it against it on our return to CDG because of kerfuffle with cases on trains etc etc; instead, we took the Air France bus from Montparnasse station. This was 16 Euros each one-way, but a guaranteed seat and dropped of right at the terminal! Overall, this hotel was about £50 per night more expensive than a four-star chain hotel (ie Hilton, Le Meridien), but it is beautifully presented and the staff are all excellent. I'd certainly rate it at least one star higher than most of the big-chain equivalents. Don't be put off by its location when you look on a map of Paris - it really is within spitting distance of all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I warmly recommend Le Six”
Reviews.Author: Kaizer66
Reviews.Content: A fresh and stylish litel hotel, exceptional service attitude. Superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Ashere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful in terms of service and location. The staff was very responsive and attentive to our needs both before and while staying with them. Their location is great with access to three metro stations. More importantly, the room is clean and very new... Great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel for a Fantastic Price”
Reviews.Author: NYC1240
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Travelocity and we were not dissapointed. The hotel is a very cute boutique hotel and the rooms are modern. We were upgraded at check in to a deluxe room, the room had beautiful hard wood floors, a fabulous shower (rain shower) and the bed was super comfortable. We were not sure what to expect, because we booked the hotel last minute and wanted something that was nice, in a great location that didn't break the bank. I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff were also very nice. (Also, the free internet access from the room is a nice touch).

Reviews.Title: “It's True!”
Reviews.Author: minnieLeeds
Reviews.Content: Everything you read here is true. Hotel Le Six is the perfect place to spend a city break in a very busy place. We arrived and were greeted very pleasantly by smiling reception staff who continued to smile and help with any and every request we had. The room was small but had everything you need including a very powerful rain shower and spacious bath. Breakfast was continental and was very satisfactory with bread, pastries, cereals, cheeses, meats, juices and hot drinks. The barman was always smiling and brought us some wonderful macaroons our first night! I highly recommend this hotel, it's not cheap but you really do get what you pay for. I would definately choose this hotel again for a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: S6_OWL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Six for 3 nights in mid June. This was our first trip to Paris and we wanted to stay somewhere nice and in a convenient location that would be best to see Paris on foot and metro. We chose Hotel Le Six after reading all the reviews on Tripadvisor and i have to say we are very glad we stayed here. This is a lovely boutique hotel in a lively part of Paris but on a quiet side street. We had a deluxe double on the 5th floor, it was a very good sized room with a huge comfy bed and massive bathroom with great shower and large bath tub. We stayed on a B&B basis and there is plenty of choice for breakfast, cererals, hams, cheese, pastries, yogurt, fruit, plenty to fill yourself up before setting out for a days sightseeing, and the service for breakfast was excellent. The hotel is well located to the Metro network, a very short walk to Vavin, Montparnasse and Notre-Dame-Des-Champs Metro stations. We didn't dine at the hotel but there are plenty of reastaurants to choose from nearby, especially on the Montparnasse Boulevard, we dined at La Coupole which we found to be very reasonable and lovely food, although very busy but it was Saturday night (30 min wait for table) All in all we loved Paris and can't wait to return and when we do we shall stay once again at Hotel Le Six

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: dianneKelownaBc
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Le Six based on trip advisor reviews and were so pleased. It was a wonderful stay. Checking in was effortless and quick and we were shown to our rooms which were very nice. We booked a suite so our room was very large for Paris standards. The bathroom was beautiful with full tub and separate shower. Our bed was very comfortable and the linens were of excellent quality. We had a beautiful fruit plate and some Parisienne macaroons in our room upon arrival - nice touch! The staff at the front desk was always very helpful and had answers to our questions and suggestions - all in English which made it so much simpler for us. Alex, the bartender, is a standout! He was so attentive, informative and fun - and really made our stay special. Breakfast was included and was superior to most breakfasts I've had at European boutique hotels. Also - free wifi internet service! That's a must! The only thing I regret is that it's a little far from the centre of everything. There are 3 metro stations so it's easy to get anywhere but I do like staying in the Saint Germain area better - I'm not that fond of Montparnasse. That being said - I still may book at Hotel Le Six on my next Paris trip because the hotel was "a find"!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent petit designed-hotel”
Reviews.Author: notstraight
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is very nice.Room is desined and comfort.Staff is very kindly and great support.I like this place very well.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: susanhf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel early in June. We found the rooms to be lovely and the hotel staff to be extremely helpful. The staff gave excellent restaurant recommendations, good directions and provided us with many helpful suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ookyspooky
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fabulous long weekend in Paris. Most days we left Le Six at 10am and didn't return until 11pm so we only really slept there. However, it was clean, comfortable, extremely close to 2 Metro lines, on a quiet side road with helpful friendly staff. What more would you want? On the down side it is a bit pricey but it is Paris and everything is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: rexhitch
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to Paris in fact overseas... we were worried about choosing somewhere to stay so we chose somewhere that tripadvisor recommended. It was quite a bit more than what we wanted to pay but we thought more money = better service and hotel. first impression was "wow" but if you stay here don't expect any extras. We stayed for 5 nights the first day there was a bottle of complimentry water... the next day it and the tea and milk was not replaced I rang reception they apologised for the tea and milk but if we wanted more water we had to pay. The next day same story with tea and milk rang reception again...... the next day only one towel was replaced.... I was sick of complaining so I used the hand towel!! I know they are minor complaints but when you pay prices like this you expect the service to be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mmm333333333
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris, and after much research we decided we wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter - we read a ton of great reviews about this place and it didn't disappoint! We stopped by the hotel bar every night, where Ilias served us up night-caps before we turned in. Overall -- rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable, staff is friendly and helpful and location is perfect -- will stay there again if we ever make it back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located gem.”
Reviews.Author: renata5
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Paris so we didn't know where to start. Le Six was offered as a choice with the tour operator. The reviews on Trip Adviser helped us choose this hotel, We were not disappointed. After a long flight, they checked us in early. The front desk was wonderful and patient with all of questions and requests. Everyone that works at the hotel is friendly and helpful !!! It is perfectly located to cafes, restaurants and shopping. The metro is a minute walk around the corner. The breakfast was wonderful. If we are lucky enough to return to Paris, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: crewtravel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel extremely! The location is absolutely perfect, right in the center, yet in a quiet street. We received a free upgrade, which made our stay even more enjoyable. Most of all: the beds are the best!! Spacious and perfect-feeling mattresses. Furthermore rooms are, for Paris standards, quite big and provision of slippers and bathrobe adds to luxurious feeling. Staff is very friendly and helpful. 3 metro stations just around the corner, many places to eat and drink. Hotelbar is nice, but quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdm68
Reviews.Content: This is our new favorite hotel: we’ve stayed there twice in the past month. It’s clean, sleekly designed, and the staff is the friendliest you’ll find in Paris (maybe the world!). The location in the 6th Arrondissement is very convenient, and it’s on a quiet side street so there’s no noise. The beds are excellent, and there’s free wi-fi. This will definitely be the place we stay in Paris from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Service Extraordinaire!”
Reviews.Author: abquiat
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived, we were welcomed and treated graciously. The server at the bar even went out and purchased a liqueur (not usually stocked at Le Six) that my wife wanted to order as we relaxed in the lounge. Try it -- you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesandSusan
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel le Six based on the strong tripadvisor reviews and can strongly recommend the hotel, and more importantly, the staff. Everyone from the Reception staff to the barman, housekeeping etc were friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough. You'll appreciate the hotel employees even more when you meet the traditionally rude waiters wherever you go for dinner outside the hotel. The hotel is well located, if you're coming from CDG airport, take the train, the BER3 runs express into Paris and it's only a few more stops to the Luxembourg stop. From there it's a 5 min walk to the hotel. We took the metro during the day and taxis at night, nowhere was more then a ten euro trip. Our room was spotless and was spacious, the bathroom was immaculate, great shower and the Molton Brown products are a nice touch. We'll stay here on our next trip. Be sure to take a lunch or dinner cruise while you're in Paris, we did the vip cruise with bateaux parisienne and would recommend it. Don't bother with the cabaret shows, we went to the crazy horse and it was pretty awful, and expensive. This hotel however is great value, well located and I would agree with the other favourable reviews posted.

Reviews.Title: “Location, sophistication”
Reviews.Author: sthrottlemeyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late April at Hotel Le Six, after staying the first part of our trip to Paris across the Seine at Hotel Brittanique, (see my review there is you are interested in comparing the two!) After exhaustive searched of Tripadvisor and other such websites, we were fraught with worry about choosing the right accommodations. With Le Six, we were totally at ease with our choice. The staff was eager to please, and handled each of our requests smoothly. They tolerated my sometimes halting attempts at French ( which got better with usage) with good nature, and other American guests who just flat-out loudly spoke English at all times (which I thought a bit rude, but c'est la vie.) The room, like 99% of others in Paris, was small; but the bathroom was comparatively large, and the bed cozy. The style of the hotel was chic-ly Euro, and the included (when we booked the room)"American breakfast," featured a good selection of cheeses, smoked salmon, and great bread and fruit juices. The negatives we found were a pretty disappointing water pressure in the shower, and an annoying sign-on for the wireless internet, which I used with my iPod Touch to look up restaurants (on Tripadvisor Mobile, of course) and send emails back home. One major score was a restaurant around the corner, Le Parc Aux Cerfs, which I'll add a review of soon. The neighborhood around the hotel was wonderful, with plenty of good eating options, an entire street lined with Creperies just up Bvd Montparnasse. (Hint: Everyone we spoke to said that Josselin Creperie was the best of the bunch; we ate there and loved it!), also many Huitres in the area (shellfish, seafood). Only a 10 minute stroll to the RER "B" line train, as well, which took us straight to CDG airport on our departure day (but not before we loaded up on baguettes, Pain de Chocolate and such for the troops back home) Also close by to the Metro, and a short walk to the posh St Germain shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rbrnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Le Six after reading all the positive reviews here. We were absolutely thrilled with the hotel, our room (a 'superior' w/ king-size bed and a tiny terrace), the location, the staff, the cleanliness, the complimentary breakfast, etc. I cannot think of a single complaint and must point out in particular how much we appreciated the night manager on duty: he lent us adaptor so we could charge our phone, served us complimentary hot tea late at night, and was courteous and pleasant throughout our visit. Hotel is quiet, modern, close to several metro stops. We thought the teeny tiny elevator was hysterical (especially when we tried to squash 2 people and 2 bags in!). We loved this hotel and will definitely recommend it to any/all who want to stay in the St. Germain/Montparnasse area.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnCW83
Reviews.Content: Great modern boutique hotel in the 6th arrondissement (at the southern end, bordering Montparnasse -- perhaps not the most central location, but pretty close to it). Our "classic" room was small, but well kept and very clean. We didn't mind the size of the room since we were only there to sleep, but the only time we did feel that it was undersized was when we realized we didn't have any drawers to put clothing in. But the bed was comfortable and it was nice and quiet. Loved the Molton Brown bath products, but they don't provide conditioner, so bring your own! The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly, and helped us make restaurant reservations even before we arrived (I contacted them easily via email). We never tried the breakfast, but there are plenty of cute cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel is situated very close to two metro stops so it was easy to get around. And, we were able to walk to most major sights (approx. 30 minutes to get to Saint Germain des Pres, 45 minutes to get to the Louvre, 45 minutes to get to the Eiffel Tower). Wireless internet is free, but it is very spotty -- luckily we only used it to check email occasionally. Overall, great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The very best!”
Reviews.Author: rzoll
Reviews.Content: Very simply the most comfortable hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere, most pleasant and helpful staff, excellent location, modern decor, absolutely delightful!

Reviews.Title: “A fair deal from a comfortable and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: KalSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in a standard rooom - (which they describe as "classic"). It was one of the ones looking out onto the inner courtyard, and while I note some reviewers had a problem with this, it is quite common in Paris and often better for the peace it affords than a street facing room. The room was exactly as described - a reasonable size FOR Paris... where I have stayed in some tiny cupboards masquerading as doubles.... The hotel staff were friendly and attentive. Booking directly with the hotel meant we had a deal which included breakfast, free WiFi, and use of the steam bath in the basement spa for up to 30 minutes a day. The breakfast we thought very good indeed, though would not have paid 22 euros each on top of room rate. Hotel is located near to montparnasse which means it is handy for lots of restaurants as well as being near Notre Dame des Champs metro (1 minute walk) and Vavin on the more useful Line 4 is two minutes away. Not in the heart of St Germain, but i knew that from looking at a map before booking. There were many nice touches, the beds comfortable, toiletries nice etc... A bit pricy, but Paris is, and the state of the pound against the euro didn't do our perception of cost much good! Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “so caring”
Reviews.Author: rolforio
Reviews.Content: I experienced the greatest staff at Le Six, so professional and caring. During the volcano-flight crisis, Fromtdesk staff did everything to help me, did many phonecalls to re-book my flight and made me feel taken care of. Will be back for sure They speak perfect English and Portuguese and Wifi is free!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: mpaulista
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at Le Six and was very happy with my room, # 604 under the roof, great view, perfect service, Manager Rolf couldn t care more. It was a delight to stay there. Will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: robcwebb
Reviews.Content: Stylish, friendly and well-located, this is one of the few reasonably-priced good experiences I have had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, lovely quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: flying01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff was wonderful and all spoke english. The room and the bathroom were good size. It was nice and quiet. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: geryllan
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend in Paris having had a wonderful time and a perfect stay in Le SIX. We were 6 ladies who were celabrating one of the larger 0 birhdays and as the organiser I had to find the hotel. Thank goodness it lived up to all the good things that had been written about it and more. My party were all well traveled and to meet their expectations at a reasonable price was not easy...................but this was a gem that none could fault. The staff were suberb and most helpful nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel itself was spotless and breakfast could not be faulted. If I am fortunate to have the chance to visit Paris again I would not stay any where else. Thank You Le Six for making our stay just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: cavedodger
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews of a variety of Paris hotels, we chose Le Six based on the combination of location, quality, user ratings, value and comfort and it turned out to be a great choice. Rue Stanislas is a quiet street located between Jardines du Luxembourg and Boulevard du Montparnasse. Reception staff are friendly and knowledgeable and seem to enjoy their job. Bellman was charming. The breakfast which was included in our rate was very good indeed with a nice spread of cheeses, fruits, cereals and breads as well as very good coffee. Our room overlooked Rue Stanislas but was still very quiet. The bed is comfortable and large and the entire room is a good size for a Paris Hotel. Bathroom was warm with nice fixtures and large walk-in shower. Decor is modern and warm at the same time. Decent size closet with digital safe which was useful. If you get good weather and like to walk you can enjoy Paris by day and night from this location. We walked all the way to the Eiffel Tower from here no problem at all. At night you are spoiled for choice for restaurants, but I suggest getting recommendations from the staff, they will help you get what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: nikimari
Reviews.Content: The team here goes above and beyond to make you feel welcomed from the moment you step into the beautiful and eclectic lobby. The decor is trendy and fun but the furniture in the lobby, lounge and dining area is comfortable. Alex the manager suggested restaurants and nightlife which made our trip even more memorable. Can't wait to return and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: newsman2008
Reviews.Content: The Hotel le Six is a super place. The decoration is modern, airy and trendy. The staff were fantastic and welcoming. Our room had a little balcony, a very comfortable bed, a large TV and a super bathroom. The traditional French breakfast of fresh baguette, pastries, ham, cheese and some hot food was fab. It's a small boutique hotel so if you like sweeping lobbies and generic service, don't come here. If you want to feel special, do. It's also in a brilliant location... loads of shops and restaurants are just seconds away, though the hotel is in a quiet street. Two different Metro lines are minutes away. When I next go to Paris, I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SergioMenezes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best breakfast I ever had! Very nice employees, tidy room and bathroom, located less than a block away from a subway station and a lot of excellent restaurants nearby. If you're Brazilian, there's a Brazilian employee who speaks 6 languages and helped the group many times, including directions to many places...

Reviews.Title: “very,ver good”
Reviews.Author: LOUISCHESHIRE
Reviews.Content: large rooms, big beds, good bathrooms excellent consistent service good value if book direct location is good, but maybe a few blocks too south

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JonTours
Reviews.Content: I live in France and stay in Paris regularly for business. It is often difficult to get consistently good hotels for your clients without paying exhorbitant rates. Le Six is well located in the restaurant area of Montparnasse and at the same time well connected for a varietey of metro lines and the TGV station. Great for work and pleasure. As a place to stay it is exceptionally smart, modern and clean, with first class service. My only regret for our weekend stay in Paris was that we did not spend more time in the hotel! If you want a sure place to stay for a great weekend or business trip then try the Six. I am certainly putting my clients there in the future, and will be staying there when in town. So book well in advance! Jon

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: lisamelo
Reviews.Content: In my first time in Paris, I tried to find some place just like my dreams. Then I found this hotel. The room is very very confortable, with a good big bed. The sheets, blankets and towels were very clean and soft. The decoration is elegant and sophisticated. The bathroom is big and have all the things a women needs. The localization is perfect, with many metro stations really close. The neighborhood is calm and silent, with good restaurants and convenience stores. I'm sure I'll stay there every time I'll go Paris. It was unforgetable!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mioloto
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Hotel Le Six was back in 2008 just after they had opened for business. I was highly impressed. The hotel is located near several Metro locations. The hotel is nicely appointed, rooms are reasonably good size, fairly large bathroom. The buffet breakfast (not included in the room rate) was nice, complete with juices, great cafe, eggs, pasteries, cheese, yogurt, etc. The staff at the front desk is FANTASTIC, very helpful and english speaking. I travel to Paris twice a year for business and each time I stay at the Hotel Le Six. While it is tempting to try another hotel in Paris, I always go back to Hotel Le Six. Keep up the excellent job Hotel Le Six!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Bella1215
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and this was also our first trip to Paris. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location with metro, restaurants and shopping right around the corner. The staff was extremely helpful and really made us feel right at home!! The breakfast and room service tasted great and the bartender was a blast to talk with! The rooms are a great size and the bathrooms are beautiful. We hope to visit Paris again and could not imagine staying at a different hotel. Thanks Hotel Le Six!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location...great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: katiej211
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Paris leg of our honeymoon. The staff was highly professional and kind. They speak good English. We used the spa, bar and fitness area during our stay. Breakfast is included and is great - American breakfast so a bit bigger. Rooms are clean and modern. We had a regular room and upgraded to a suite, so saw both. Both were very nice. The location is great. Right around the corner from a Metro stop. We often went down the road to Montparnasse to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent, room was new & clean. Service was superb”
Reviews.Author: LisaCopito
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new (operates a Year and a half ?)one, very stylish,modern chic but comfortable.the bathroom is superb.the room is good sized but not very big.The ambience is excellent ,the stuff are very helpful.they serve a splendid breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LasBeatas
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the staff greeted us like we were very special guests. The room was modern and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and of good quality. There are a number of good restuarants close by and the 3 metro lines take you to anywhere you need to go. What more could you ask for Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: nads8481
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Le Six over Thanksgiving break. The hotel is brand new, the rooms are very clean and pretty spacious by European standards. We stayed in a suite and really enjoyed the extra space. The breakfast each morning is fantastic, with quality food and good service. Definately take advantage of the complimentary steam bath in the spa! The reception staff are very friendly and very helpful - they were very pleasant when we needed restaurant recommendations and show reservations. The maintenance staff is also very thorough and very courteous. There are several metro stops within walking distance - making the rest of Paris extremely accessible. The 12 line metro is only 1 block away. Saint Michel's Latin Quarter is also in walking distance, along with all it's fantastic brasseries. All-in-all a fantastic experience at this hotel, and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fun, comfortable and stylish!”
Reviews.Author: PeterA7
Reviews.Content: We can't decide which we liked best. The huge bed, the luxury bath or the fantastic breakfasts. The furnishings are sleek and the people who work there are happy so they can't help but be helpful. There are three metro stops within 2-5 minutes walk so the location isd grand. We walked to the Seine a few times, 15-20 min and it's less than 5 min to the gardens at Luxemborg. This one of the nicest hotels that we have ever stayed at. The spa is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff extremely helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Abina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, staff were extremely friendly, had a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gio_from_monza
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with exceptionally clean rooms, wooden floor and a spacious bathroom. Great location on a quiet road in the heart of Montparnasse with restaurants, bistros and wonderful creperies. A little expensive, especially the breakfast if not included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: flowerdaisy
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel ever. Not the cheapest but if you can afford it and if you have to pass by Paris, go there, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay at le six again if we travel to Paris again!”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsCAustralia
Reviews.Content: A very lovely boutique hotel located at a quite street. My husband and I stayed there for three nights at their junior suite. The bed is a king size and very comfy. I loved the bed sheets and pillows, very soft... The breakfast was lovely and they had a good range of choices. We especially think the people who work there are very helpful and friendly... They do have a little gym area, but it is a very basic one.(you don't really need a gym in Paris as there is so much to see... and after a whole day of sight seeing, you would just want to pop into a lovely bath in the hotel) If you are from Australia, you may find the rooms are a bit smaller compared to our hotels. Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “an oasis of quiet and calm”
Reviews.Author: vernongirl3
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself was stylish and quiet, so close to the metro and Luxemburg Gardens, but best of all was the staff. they were all so friendly and helpful. they spoke excellent English and really made us feel welcome and taken care of. would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: tabersboss
Reviews.Content: My second visit here, by choice, and the hotel met our expectations and beyond. Courteous and well-informed staff went out of their way to make dinner reservations, listen to our comments, and to secure what we needed. I will go back whenever I can afford to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: hmbooks
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris and staying at Hotel Le Six helped make our stay a perfect one. The hotel was modern, clean and very comfortable. The hotel staff were helpful and accomodating. We would definitely stay there when in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, no cupboard space!”
Reviews.Author: mansole
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very pretty, modern and clean. It really lacked storage in the room I had. I could hang only about 3 things! Not pratical for business travel. I also prefer staying closer to the action...this one was bit far away from all the fun!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable and elegant hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Massolino
Reviews.Content: Stylish and minimalist without at all being cold, this very comfortable hotel turned out to be perfect for our weekend stay in Paris. The staff was very helpful in a quiet and unintrusive kind of way, and the whole hotel has a wonderful understated and non-flashy quality. I found nothing I didn't thoroughly like here, it's perfectly balanced, and also in my favourite part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Parfait.”
Reviews.Author: Westmount
Reviews.Content: Is there a trip you've taken that you could reasonably describe as perfect? Our September trip of a week in Paris was, and a large part of it was due to the incredible friendliness of the staff, charming and elegant accommodations, and stones-throw proximity to three Metro stops at Le Six in Paris. Rolf (hotel manager) and Angela (concierge/front desk staff) truly went out of their way to make us feel more than at home--more like a member of their family. From our 8 am arrival on the red-eye from Charlotte, we were greeted warmly and made welcome; even though our room was not ready yet (and we didn't expect it to be, at 8 am!), Angela made sure ours was the first one cleaned. Rolf and Angela were able to find us reservations at Ze kitchen Galerie, La Mediterranee, and were on-spot with their ideas and recommendations-all while being cheery and efficient. We even received a room upgrade to a Deluxe, and I tell you--there is nothing like it. Other staff were excellent as well, and I'm ashamed that I don't know everyone's name! The rooms are spotless. The decor is modern and very striking. Breakfast was fantastic--fresh fruit ,yogurts, chocolate croissants--you name it. The street Le Six is on is quiet and residential, excellent for a good night's rest, yet still steps away from 3 Metro stops. Across the street is Chez Marcel, which is a wonderful local restaurant with classic French specialties, and a warm family atmosphere. Have the Coq au vin. Down the street, Creperie Henri has great crepes for that afternoon snack after you've been walking all day....we'd been there so many times by the end of our trip we were asked "L'habitude?"(the usual?). The hotel is a perfect combination of chicness with an atmosphere of warmth by the staff. You will not be disappointed. Stay here. Just leave room for me--I will return!

Reviews.Title: “First Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: Avers55
Reviews.Content: Trying to pick a hotel out of the hundreds available in Paris was difficult, but thank goodness something drew me to Hotel Le Six. A lovely clean modern hotel near to metro stations and with plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance, although the hotel itself was in a quiet side street and we were not disturbed by noise at night. The rooms were very clean and not a bad size, bathroom was lovely, only downside was the shower temperature was a little erratic. The staff were very helpful and pleasant and spoke English if you needed them to. I would definitely return to Paris and the Hotel Le Six.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: TinTinBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in Hotel Le Six. The standard room was large, spotlessly clean and a bathroom to die for! The bathroom is fitted out with high end fittings and could be the best shower I have ever had. The situation of the hotel is great. We were just around the corner from the hop on hop off bus, Luxemborg Gardens were just down the block and at the end of the street their was Blvde Montparnasse, full of great restaurants and bars. We had 4 nights in Le Six and then returned at the end of our trip for one final night. We spent our last night in a Deluxe Suite. We thought the standard room was great but the deluxe was fantastic. Very large and would fit a rollaway in with no problems. The bathroom was very luxurious and also had a full size bath.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Professional”
Reviews.Author: RubyFoodie
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Le Six. We have always booked a superior room and have been very happy with our choice. On our last trip, we made the mistake of staying at a hotel in the heart of the St. Germain, but after one night of moldy carpets, dark curtains and a lingering odor at a higher room rate, we switched back the the Le Six. We'll never stray again. The staff is extremely pleasant and courteous and of the utmost professional manner. Unlike other hotels that we've stayed at in Paris over the years, the rooms are modern with functioning plumbing, soft comfortable beds and have an airy feel that make for a perfect comfort level. The rooms are small, however, this is typical throughout Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WillJen888
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Six is in a great location - we would typically stay on the other side of Paris, however at le six we were able to visit lots of local shops. Rooms are big and new. The hotel is also very close to the metro. Free wifi is included, however there are mainly only French / German channels on the TV (English news only). The hotel were also very helpful in organising for a pair of cufflinks that i left behind to be sent to me.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel with charm and elegance....”
Reviews.Author: CommishZ
Reviews.Content: Manager Rolf Sagemuller has perfected the art of chic elegance and charm in this lovely boutique hotel in the St. Germain district in the 6th Arrondissement in Paris. St. Germain has an easy charm and Sagemuller made our stay reflect that in a seamless way. The staff (Jan welcomed us attending to every detail with warmth and an engaging efficiency) is friendly and helpful, and the hotel rooms and common areas are tastefully appointed. Our Superior room had a small terrace and modern furnishings providing every detal one would want to make for the perfect stay. It is clear nothing was left to chance and, upon request, Mr. Sagemuller ensured our every need was met. The spa provides an opportunity to unwind and relax in a new-age setting and the masseuse was friendly and warm. Paris provides one choices galore in lodging - from the quaint to the oppulent. Hotel Le Six was the perfect balance for us and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty boutique-style hotel with knowledgeable and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: brixtonpavilion
Reviews.Content: Very nice and well-located, and not too pricey. Breakfast nice and expensive if not included in package

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos74NewYork
Reviews.Content: Great little 'boutique' hotel on a quiet little street just off Blvd. Raspail in the 6th arrondisement. Two different metro stations just steps away, while the great cafés and shops of the Saint Germain neighborhood just minutes away by foot. Also, great restaurants along Montparnasse Avenue just around the corner. We had booked a 'superior' room but got upgraded to a wonderful 'junior suite' on the top floor...absolutely fantastic, balcony, lots of windows, huge bathroom, and great Paris rooftop views with the Sacre Coeur in the distance. Has a spa and gym, but didn't use it. Breakfast was expensive, but who cares when there is a bakery around the corner. I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love-the-Mud-Hen
Reviews.Content: I am was really happy with our stay at Hotel Le Six. I was conveniently located between three metro stops and was easily identified on the side street. The staff was welcoming and allowed us to check-in early after our journey. They were courteous and incredibly helpful in making recommendations and reservations. The included breakfast can even be enjoyed in your room. The rooms themselves were beautiful, spacious and most importantly immaculately clean. I definitely recommend them!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place in Paris - LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Athena5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Hotel Le Six for five nights, and we loved it. While this boutique hotel is quite lovely all on its own, the exceptional, friendly staff make it even more so. First, however, I'll comment on the rooms. We stayed in a suite, which is a nice size and is well-appointed in a contemporary style. We like the suite because it has a door separating the livingroom from the bedroom (we don't always wake up at the same time, so this configuration afforded us a bit more shut-eye if one of us were up and about). If this isn't a concern, however, the junior suites are very nice, as well, but don't have the separating door. We didn't see any other rooms, so we can't comment. The bathrooms have a large tub and large walk-in shower, all surrounded by brownish marble. The hotel offers Moulton Brown toiletries - a nice touch. The rooms are large by Parisian standards, but well-priced. They are likewise a comfortable size by North American standards. There are many restaurants and shops near the hotel, but to access most tourist sites requires about a 10-minute metro ride. The metros are located very close to the hotel, so it's no problem. Also, the hotel staff are excellent at giving directions (whether you're traveling by foot, metro, or bus), so you're sure not to get lost. We absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Le Six, especially because the staff is so exceptional. They are competent, friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable - absolutely top-notch (and we're not easy customers to please!). It felt like coming home whenever we returned to the hotel from a day's excursion. Staff members go out of their way to help solve any problems you might encounter (problems that will likely be of no relation to the hotel). They really do go above and beyond to make your stay special and easy. I had a massage at the spa on the lower level, and highly recommend it. The rooms have a soothing East Asian contemporary vibe to them and, apparently, there's even a hammam (although I didn't try it). All in all, we highly recommend Hotel Le Six. The only suggestion for improvement I could make is for the hotel to offer room service. Otherwise, we highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine052
Reviews.Content: We chose Le Six based on the Tripadvisor reviews we had read and we were extremely pleased with our choice. In brief, it is a stylish hotel with exceptional staff and is in a fantastic location. We could safely recommend it to even the most discerning traveller. The public rooms and bedrooms are tastefully decorated and furnished in a contemporary style. The bathrooms are spacious, luxurious and spotlessly clean. All staff are very pleasant and helpful, especially in liaising with our taxi company for our return journey to the airport. It is also in a great location, only 2 minutes walk from 3 Metro stops serving the main lines across Paris and 5 minutes walk from the Opentour bus stop. This makes it very easy to visit all the sites across the city. Le Six is situated in a quiet peaceful street making it a relaxing place to stay and yet the surrounding streets are filled with upmarket restaurants and bars and a wide selection of shops. It has a lively, pleasant ambiance both during the day and in the evening. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel - best bathroom in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at Le Six. The rooms were well appointed, beds very comfortable and a decent size considering how small European hotel rooms can be. The hotel is very chic and decorated in a eclectic way. Staff was very helpful and polite, always greeting you as you walked to and fro from the hotel. The bathroom had the biggest shower I've ever seen in Europe and looked newly renovated! The location is excellent with the Metro stop a block away and several historical icons within walking distance. Plenty of shops as well are in the area and lots of cute bistros... The breakfast, which was included in our price, was very yummy with tons of options, though I think just going out for a crossaint in the morning is a better way to experience the city!

Reviews.Title: “A Huge letdown. Not likely to return”
Reviews.Author: tda7
Reviews.Content: After a previous enjoyable stay here last month, we were looking forward to another couple of days at Le Six. It didn't live up to expectations. The room we were allocated was tiny and claustrophobic overlooking the central vent shaft. When we pointed this out, one of the receptionists agreed that he would change our room the following day. The wireless didn't work. The next day, the receptionists were rude and combatitive. They wanted us to pay for an 'upgraded' room but eventually agreed to change it free of charge. Their attitude left us feeling uncomfortable and unwelcome. After that, they barely acknowledged us as we went through reception. The new room had some issues with it but we did't bring them up as we did not feel able to. We will not be returning here which is a shame as I had previously recommended this hotel so highly. More Hotel Le Stress than Le Six.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdgirlluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Le Six. We arrived at about 9:00am from San Diego and were checked into our rooms immediately (thanks Morgan!!). The lobby area is all done in red and is quite stunning. The staff were all friendly and helpful with recommendations for food and train/metro information. Rooms small but lovely - nice sized bathrooms and very clean and modern. Location is excellent - close to metro, restaurants and shoppping. If you have a fun sense of humor - use the "other" elevator once in a while. Would totally stay there again - loved everyone who was on staff during our trip - Audrey was a complete doll and the young Italian gentleman (so sorry - his name escapes me, which is a total shame because he gave us the best recommendations and help!!!) spent plenty of time helping us and even serving up some drinks! Can't say enough about the staff! Suggestions: Bring conditioner or go to the nearest Pharmacie for it - the hotel does not provide it (at least not in our room) Bottled water and wine can be bought by turning left outside of the hotel to the end of the block, then left again - a natural food store is right there and has good prices - 3 minute walk. Cafes, restaurants and metro stops are to the right - 5 minute walk. Use the Metro and bus - super easy - mobilus pass is the way to go for a day of sightseeing - 5.90 Euro for all day, bus and metro lines anywhere in the city. Breakfast at the hotel is 22 Euro - we ate down the street for much less. Drinks at the hotel are costly too, but we had a few anyway!! Would totally stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RFDupont
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris, now that we've stayed at Hotel Le Six. The location is perfect, and the hotel is immaculate, chic and comfortable. But most importantly, the staff is the best in Paris. Unlike some hotels where the receptionists confuse snootiness with class, each and every employee we met was warm, kind and helpful. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome, including my teenagers and energetic youngest. We arrived from an overnight flight many hours before check-in, expecting only to leave our luggage for the intervening hours. Instead, they allowed us to check in immediately which was a huge relief with three boys (18, 16 and 9). We were able to rest and shower and start our first day in Paris feeling rested and refreshed instead of dragging ourselves around until we could check in to our rooms. I've done that and it is not fun. The staff is multilingual, but they were kind enough to let me practice my tortured French on them. Free wireless is a huge plus for my teenagers and me, and they even loaned us electrical adapters, as I had forgotten ours at home. Even though the gym is very small, my husband and older sons used it every day. But really, who needs a gym in Paris? You walk or bike everywhere, so a full day of activities is all the exercise you need. The breakfast at 22 Euros is expensive when there are so many cafes so close. Nevertheless, two of my sons partook on our last morning and said it was delicious. I had intended to join them, but soaking in the deep bathtub full of Molton Brown bubbles was a luxury for which I was willing to give up food. Amazing toiletries included a luxurious tube of lip moisturizer that I made sure to take with me when we left. We spent a few days in Aix-en-Provence before returning to le Six. Unfortunately my youngest son left his suitcase on the platform in the excitement of boarding the TGV. Audrey Pernot, the front desk manager, was unbelievably helpful, even offering to pick it up in Aix when she traveled to a town about 60 km away later in the month and send it to us in the States. I'm still humbled by her kindness. There isn't enough of that in the world, and even less it seems in four star hotels in major world cities. I could continue raving about our stay, but I'm already afraid that when the rest of the world learns about Hotel Le Six, we won't be able to book a room on our next trip. (We had a penthouse suite which was a suite with two spacious (by Paris standards) bedrooms and living room with fold out sofa and two exquisite bathrooms. Beautiful balconies, wonderful light and comfortable beds. We stayed for three nights and then returned for one night after a short trip to Provence.)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Meo3
Reviews.Content: Incredibly helpful staff, wonderful location, room, and bathroom. Made our trip absolutely perfect. Will book my next Paris stay at this charming and perfectly decorated and maintained hotel. Massage at the spa after several days of intense walking revived and restored my aching and tired body. No disappointments here at all. I highly recommend Hotel Le Six.

Reviews.Title: “A Complete Gem”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMacAustralia
Reviews.Content: What a find, a delightful boutique Hotel with fantastic staff who cared for their guests, nothing was too much trouble. My 17 yr old daughter and I loved our beautiful modern room with french windows and juliette type balcony, it was a wonderful haven to return to each night after our tourist explorations of this fantastic city. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Paris, well priced, clean and very chic.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: KGBLA
Reviews.Content: If you prefer a hotel that is quiet, well appointed and well kept, and has a great staff, then this is the place. I have stayed at many hotels in the 6th (my personal favorite arrondissement) and this is the best so far. The rooms are not large, but are just fine. The bathrooms are absolutely the best. The beds are firm and give a good nights sleep. If you stay here, check out one of the best little restaurants in Paris called "le carre de marguerite" a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Six is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EWChicago
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Six and was very pleased. Cute hotel, nice location and freindly staff. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Staff helped me with all my needs and would reccommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Paris”
Reviews.Author: E_Hemingway
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in paris several times and have become used to dissapointment in the hotels. This is a four star, and by Paris standards, I agree. But, not by standards outside of Paris. The service friendly and room clean and well appointed. Ok size too. But all just OK if you compare to Asia or US. The bed was a true double...not two singles pushed together. Shower was a highlight, but low pressure let it down a bit. Still, for the money, I would stay here again and recommend it. Location is great if you want left bank. Close to a metro and walking distance to central Paris. Warning: Check if breakfast is included. If not, there is no way it worth the 22 Euro they want for it. Very basic. Better off heading out onto the stree where there is plenty of choice (even a starbucks for the Americans).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: blcNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayd at Le Six for a business meeting and must say that it is very convenient for small meetings, extremely comfortable and quiet rooms. Free Wifi, great multilingual staff, hotel seems o be very popular with chic Brazilians, but also a few Americans. Will definetely be back with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Le Six”
Reviews.Author: marcosaopaulo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Six with our 2 teenage kids in 2 connecting rooms and had a great stay. Many staff members speak portuguese and perfect English. Concierge very helpful and efficient. Great restaurants around and easy acces to public transportation. Manager was around all the time and could not care more about our well-beeing. Will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Happy friendly staff made our stay so good!”
Reviews.Author: s1ward
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Le Six in Paris for 3 nights this summer and wanted to express how happy we were with the hotel and in particular the hotel reception staff - I cannot single out one as they were all lovely! The hotel is in an excellent area with easy access to all the attractions of Paris. We found the rooms clean and comfortable. Most of all we wanted to commend the very nice reception staff. We will come back to this hotel again next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!! Would highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLONOJO
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Hotel Le Six last week and it was an absolute pleasure. What a fantastic hotel!!! Great location! 2 minute walk from a Metro station (there are 2 others close by) . About Le Six: we booked through Expedia and only had the photos to go by. I thought, like previous hotel reservations when unfamiliar with the location, the photos would be deceiving. Not with this hotel, it is actually much nicer in person. We had booked a superior room and it was the equivalent of a suite. Great bathroom, huge attention to detail, good complementary products, walk-in glass shower, huge tub, ample closet space, sofa, desk, table and chair. The staff went out of their way to be courteous and accommodating. Also, there is a 2008-09 Zagat rated restaurant across the street and a lot of other great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay at Hotel le Six.”
Reviews.Author: Haligonians2
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel last week in a deluxe room ... just great! We were greeted and checked in by Audrey who was terrific. She was a complete professional - friendly, knowledgeable, highly competent and she helped us organize visits to various locations. Other staff (e.g., at the desk, in the restaurant, and housekeeping) were also very professional, friendly and helpful. Our room was excellent! It was a good size for two and it was clean, modern, bright and highly functional. The bed was very comfortable, the air conditioning worked well and the bathroom was quite chic. In-room amenities such as a fridge and robes and slippers were appreciated. The hotel is on a very quiet side street, but we were very close to two subway stations (three minute walk). Boulevard Montparnasse is less than two minutes walk from the hotel and is a great spot for people watching, sight seeing, eating, and drinking. The St. Germain district and the Latin Quarter were within easy walking distance (15-20) with lots to see on the way. We would definitely stay there again! Pat and Jeff, Halifax, Nova Scotia

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: golfmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel ruined alovely trip to Paris. We needed to stay an extra night in Paris and stopped by this hotel to see a room. The suite we were shown was perfect and we booked it and prepaid. We we told more than once that this would be our room. We we checked in it was not that room but one half the size for the same price. All of a sudden they did not understand English. There was nothing done. they could not and would not explain why our room that we had paid for was given to some one else because the hotel was supposedly full they couldn't move us. This place is a rip off.  We asked for an extra pillow no pillows or towels. I can not stress  do not stay here. They do not honor your reservation even one paid for!!!!!!!!!!!  The fitness room are three machines on the 6th floor as you walk off the elevator what a joke.

Reviews.Title: “En anglais - dommage!”
Reviews.Author: morins
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris and Le Hotel Six for one week at the beginning of June 2009. Everything about my stay was wonderful! The hotel is simply delightful, a lovely boutique hotel on a quiet street off the Blvd. Montparnasse. Customer service was exemplary and I was greeted each day with a very cheerful, "Bonjour!" In particular, the Chef de Reception, Audrey, was so very wonderful. She was instantly likeable and friendly while remaining polished and professional. Audrey had wonderful advice for me and her tips were welcome! My room was also lovely and the bath products, by Moulton Brown, my favorite! It was comfortable and luxurious at the same time, and, never noisy. I had petit dejeuner, in the breakfast room twice and it was delicious both times. I didn't get a chance to use the spa, but I will when I return - and I definitely will! Finally, the location was wonderful. Just a small walk to my favorite place on earth - les Jardins des Luxembourgs - so incredibly beautiful. This was my 10th or 11th trip to Paris (yes, my favorite city) and one of the best experiences I've had. One big reason is the lovely hotel and staff. I can't wait to return! Merci Beaucoup! -

Reviews.Title: “The Suite Life in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NonprofitMom
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from a suite in the wonderful Hotel Le Six, Paris. I'm thrilled with this hotel! It's very modern and comfortable, with everything one might need for an outstanding stay. The regular rooms are of reasonable size, but the wonderful Nicolas, from the front desk, offered us a suite for a surcharge that I was glad to pay (since we were here for eight days). It's very roomy and such a wonderful home away from home! We had the hotel's breakfast in the mornings and it was outstanding, truly a great start to our wonderful days. We're literally less than a block from a Metro station which makes the location wonderfully convenient, and there's lots to explore in this neighborhood as well. Every question we've had has been answered with great politeness by the hotel staff. I'm so happy that we chose this hotel for our stay in Paris. And one cannot beat the free Internet that's allowing me to post this tonight! I wholeheartedly recommend the Hotel Le Six!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld011
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent five nights in Paris at Hotel Le Six. Overall we were quite happy with our choice of hotel for our first visit to Paris. Since it was our first visit we did alot of sightseeing and were quite busy/tired so it was nice to come back to a room/hotel we enjoyed and could relax in. The positives: Very friendly and helpful english speaking front desk staff - overall they were really great and pleasant to interact with and made our stay that much more enjoyable Very clean rooms and prompt housekeeping and no smell of cigarette smoke whatsoever in the rooms/hotel We were staying in the jr. suite on the top floor, it has a beautiful bathroom and the room feels like you are staying in your own little apartment in Paris. Minimalist/modern decor with hardwood floors Ironing board/iron available in room Potential Downfalls: You can be fooled by the address, despite the address of being in the 6th arrondissment so you are in fact at the edge of it away from the heart of the area and you end up being closer to the Montparnasse area. Which is not a bad thing, it has cute cafes/shops in the area and we enjoyed it, but some people may find it far from the sites if they are only staying a few days. The internet connection was on and off during our visit which we did need access to so that was frustrating The breakfast buffet was quite minimal and sparse - we only did it once and opted to eat at the local restaurants instead We could hear the next door guest walking around his room in the evenings, luckily he was by himself and we didn't hear any talking etc. to keep us up. I think if you are flexible in terms of the area you would like to stay in and want something newer with a more modern decor and are not a smoker, Hotel Le Six is a good boutique hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - A must for all visitors to Paris”
Reviews.Author: BKHK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights after reading the reviews on trip advisor. As it turned out it was an excellent choice and our thanks goes to all the previous travellers who posted reviews. We had travelled all the way from Hong Kong via London and wanted not only a good location in order to see Paris but also a clean, comfortable environment , in a safe area and with helpful staff. We got all of this and more, especially with the Hotel being a few minutes walk from Vavin Metro station (incidentally this is the same Metro line that will take you to and from Gare De Nord without need to change trains) . The room was spacious for Paris, immaculately clean, at a good temperature and very comfortable - and this was a standard room. All the hotel staff were openly friendly and on hand to assist with all the enquiries we had - exactly what we needed. Thanks to them we had a stress free holiday and we left Paris wanting to return. Unfortunately, we had rain for a few days during our stay and the umbrellas provided free by the Hotel were a nice touch and well needed. We didn't eat at the Hotel but in reality there was no need. Within a stones throw there is an abundance of cafes and we usually took a 10 minute walk to Germain De Pres which had even more choice. Also the restaurant just opposite the Hotel (Chez Marcel) is a must, although get there early or book as it gets very busy. When we do return Paris we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Le Six. Thanks to all the Hotel team for their excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Sirus10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to Paris for the first time to see all of the sights and celebrate my 30th Birthday. We stayed at Hotel Le Six after looking through tripadvisor, and seeing the good reviews. A friend of mine suggested that we stayed in the 5th or 6th district as it was upmarket, and not too touristy. The hotel is located in a fantastic part of Paris - there are 3 metro stations all within a 2-3 min walk on different lines so you can get out and about really easily. The area is nice and quiet, but a 30 second walk and you are onto a main road that has everything that you'd need - bars, restaurants, tabacs etc. The area also seems very safe, we got back at about midnight once and walked from the metro station to the hotel and felt very safe. The hotel decor is really nice, obviously been done recently. The rooms are great - quite small, but apparently most are in Paris. The bathrooms are also really nicely decorated, and have 1st class products for you to use. I would recommend this hotel as top class. We'd definately stay here if we went back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We finally found our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: thommynyc
Reviews.Content: Staff was incredible, they made us feel at home at ant moment of our 3 night stay. The concierge gave us very good recommandations for retaurants and bars, he booked our citytours with a very good English speaking limodriver. We definetely will be back there soon

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good service!”
Reviews.Author: Bjornracing
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris to get married and stayed at the Le Six for 5 nights with friends and family. The staff imitate came out as we arrived and picked up all our luggage and then give us a nice welcome when we entered the lobby. We did not expect this from a 4 star. The staff also helped us out in many different ways as we needed some help with some of the practical issues with the wedding, they helped making it a very nice day. They also recommended many good restaurants, booked tables and made maps where they marked out where to go, brilliant! The rooms are quite small, but really nice. Excellent beds and nice bathroom as well. The location is good, only 2 minutes walk to Montparnasse. We highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris, and will absolutely stay here the next time we visit Paris. Bjorn Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay - Modern, Comfortable, Elegant”
Reviews.Author: fredstersmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel le Six for six nights in May, and we had such a marvelous time at this charming, modern boutique hotel. We booked based on great reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not at all disappointed. The rooms are all new and modern, the mattress is incredibly comfortable, and the bathrooms are fantastic, complete with delicious bath products. The staff was warm and welcoming. The location is amazing, as there are three different metro lines within a couple blocks. We booked on the internet, and therefore got an extremely good rate for a hotel of this caliber. We would stay here again without reservation, and hope we get the chance to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and so welcoming”
Reviews.Author: HansAntwerpen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Le Six last weekend and really must say that we had the most wonderful stay we ever had in Paris. Staff was just overwhelming. They are all fluent in English and apparently speak many other languages as I heard at the front desk. Rooms are spacious and very well designed. Ironing board and coffe maker are definetely not the standard in Paris, at Le Six it is. Concierge recommanded some great restaurants around and their breakfast buffet was just perfect, a bit of everything. Will definetely go back there Hans Antwerpen

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Louisvilletravelers
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted upon arrival and told we would have a room upgrade. We were given a deluxe room which was lovely. We treated ourselves to a massage in their spa which was an excellent experience. The staff was always helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Le Six”
Reviews.Author: MaudGlasgow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked in to the sister hotel Le Relais St Jacques. On arrival we were told that we were being moved to Hotel Le Six due to "technical work". We felt very hesitant about this but were reassured that it would be just as nice. We had already treated ourselves to an upgrade to a superior room (about £190 per night). When we arrived at Le Six the receptionist told us we were to stay in their Junior Suite, one of their finest rooms (goes for 600 euros per night on the price list!). The room wasn't huge, there was no sitting area, but very nice. Lovely bed with huge pillows and good quality linen. Fantastic bath room with shower and bath tub, lovely bath products, and a separate WC. The room also had a view over Sacre Coeur if you craned your head out of the window! The location is the best with two metros on 2-3 minutes walk and Le Jardins de Luxembourg very close. We never had anything to eat or drink at the hotel as it was very expensive even for Paris. The staff were very friendly and helpful and everyone we spoke to were happy to switch to English. We had a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Replant
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had the great good fortune to stay at Le 6. The hotel is in a very nice, quiet, residential neighborhood near shopping and cafes. It was a charming oasis of calm after our long drive into the city from the country side. The service and attitude of the staff was incredible despite the fact that our initial reservations were at their sister hotel. We could hardly believe our good fortune when we saw our room-----spacious, well decorated, immaculate and comfortable. The beds were roomy with good qualty linens and the bathroom well equiped with towels and toiletries. There was a safe, iron/ ironing board, and a small bar with snack food and drinks at reasonable prices. Room service was speedy and with good food. A cozy breakfast room welcomed us with a variety of morning offerings as well a good coffee. Luigi and his entire staff were personable and professional -----------they couldn't have been nicer! We were in France for 8 days and it certainly appears that we saved the best for last: American comfort and French charm.

Reviews.Title: “great romantic parisian getaway”
Reviews.Author: sgworld
Reviews.Content: We have travelled the world and, considering the staff, ambiance, service and rooms this is the best boutique hoel we have ever had the pleasure staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDamico
Reviews.Content: We escaped for a quick weekend trip and were pleasantly surprised by our selection of Le Six. The staff, especially Luigi, were beyond gracious and helpful. The hotel is in a fantastic location for walking or taking the Metro. We look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely time at Hotel Le Six...”
Reviews.Author: knotheadusc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Six is located on Rue Stanislas, a quiet street in the Montparnasse district of Paris. We arrived from our late afternoon flight feeling a bit tired and grumpy from the Air France shuttle bus. The hotel was a short walk from the bus stop near the Montparnasse Tower, which made it very easy to find from any spot in Paris. All we had to do was look for the big black tower and head in that direction. General Information Hotel Le Six consists of 35 rooms and six suites. It's decorated in a modern motif, with lots of reds and oranges, along with pictures of planets. There's a big screen television in the lobby. When we were there, it seemed like there was a continous fashion show going on. Hotel Le Six has a spa, a small cocktail bar (which is run on the honor system), and a small fitness room. Breakfast is offered for 22 euros per person. We did not use the spa, but the man who checked us in told us the hammam is free for guests to use as long as they make an appointment. Check in Checking in was a breeze. A nicely dressed young man who spoke excellent English took us to room 506, a classic (low end) room at the end of the hall. Our room Our classic room was fairly small and interestingly laid out. It was sort of like a horseshoe, with the bathroom on the other side of the room. There was a very comfortable king sized bed, a large window that opened into a decorated shaft, a telephone, a mini bar and a closet. The room came with free wifi; we asked for the code from the reception. There was also a small desk and a flat screen television mounted on the wall. The television got several news channels in English; I can't comment on what else was available, since my husband pretty much manned the remote. Unfortunately, the room was so small that it was hard to actually sit at the desk. I was glad to see that the room also had a coffee set up that even included hot chocolate, even if we didn't use it. The bathroom The bathroom had a nice tub and a rainfall shower. However, the first time I tried to get in the tub, I slipped and bruised the inside of my legs. The same thing happened to my husband when he tried it. Also, there was a screen mounted on the tub, but it didn't the greatest job keeping the water from getting on the floor. The bathroom came with high end toiletries, a towel warmer, a makeup mirror, bathrobes, and very nice, soft towels. Service We found a nice welcome note left on the desk for us upon arrival. There was a magazine about Paris in English, as well as a couple of French magazines. The maid service was prompt about cleaning the room and did a very thorough job. We came back to the room on Saturday and took a nap, then went out again until the evening. When we got back, the bed was remade and turned down. Two nougats were left on our pillows. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, too. Noise There was very little noise to speak of at Hotel Le Six. In fact, while Montparnasse is a rather busy, bustling, noisy part of Paris, we immediately noticed a drop in the noise level as soon as we turned onto Rue Stanislas. The hotel is located on a lovely tree lined street next to a big, beautiful church. The whole area is very serene; in fact, the Luxembourg Gardens are a short walk away. If you're looking for a quiet place to sleep, Hotel Le Six is likely to fit the bill nicely. We found the bed to be very comfortable, too. I slept like a rock. Some things to know Hotel Le Six is not very close to the big tourist spots in Paris. We were able to walk to the Eiffel Tower, but it was a bit of a hike. Luckily, there is a metro stop very close to Hotel Le Six for those who would rather not walk. Frankly, I was kind of glad not to be right in the heart of tourist land. Check in is at 2:00pm. Check out is at noon. One child aged 3 and under may stay for free when sharing the room with a parent. Please inform the hotel ahead of time. Small dogs can be accommodated. There's a great sushi place right next door to the hotel, as well as a very interesting French/Iranian/Greek style restaurant at the end of Rue Stanislas. There are also several nearby good places to go for breakfast if you don't want to spend 22 euros a person for the American buffet at the hotel. Overall We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Le Six and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. However, we would advise looking online for a good deal. Our room had a rack rate of 300 euros, which I thought was a bit expensive for what we got. The 189 euros per night rate we got from Expedia.com was more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JadoreParis11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week-long vacation in Paris and we absolutely adored this hotel. Our room was immaculately clean, the service was always incredibly pleasant, and it was very quiet. I have lived in Paris and have been back many times and this was by far my favorite hotel. The rooms are quite modern in terms of decor and the bathrooms are surprisingly spacious, with great showers. We chose to upgrade to a suite, as the concierge offered it to us for a reasonable additional fee, which allowed us to check in right away (after an all-night flight) and included their delicious breakfast buffet each day. The hotel staff was very accommodating and we found the breakfast buffet to be a very nice treat every morning. I will definitely be going back to stay at le Six on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the spring time”
Reviews.Author: colin_b55
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel situated in a quiet side street, ideal to use as a base to see Paris. Arrived at Gard du Nord and battled the metro across the city to Vavin. From there a short walk to the hotel, situated not far from the Montparnasse Tower and close to a range of shops, bars, and bistros. Staff very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Larger than expected room, stayed 3 nights. Weather was good so we were able to walk everywhere - tiring, but you get to see more and stop whenever you like. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Montparnasse Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHP1994
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights week of April 6th for business. Check-in was prompt and courteous. Rooms were large by Parisian standards, clean, and nicely appointed. Free Wi-Fi a nice bonus. Just ask for the password from the front desk. Great breakfast spread but typically spendy by U.S. standards. My only criticism of the hotel is the lack of a real bar, but with all the nearby establishments, not a real concern either. Great location for walking around after business meetings concluded. Great Brasseries and Bistros nearby with a fantastic neighborhood feel. I will definitely put this hotel on the short list for future stays in Paris on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: design-life
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le Six and it was an amazing hotel. The staff, service and room were more than accommodating. It's location takes you into a more residential neighborhood, where you can experience the real Paris. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who's ever been there and to newcomers who want to see what the city is really about. Thanks for an great weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't choose this hotel but were so glad we ended up here”
Reviews.Author: BridgetProvence
Reviews.Content: We were moved here from Observatoire Luxembourg which was had no rooms left in spite of us booking weeks ago. The Six was a pleasant surprise and we can't fault our stay except for the empty courtesy tray (and that was quickly rectified.) The bed linen and towels were excellent quality - lovely thick fluffy towels!! Soft comfy pillows. Pleasant and helpful staff. Two minutes from metro. Quiet room was spotlessly clean. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here to make the most of Paris”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust210
Reviews.Content: I just returned home to New York after a long flight from Paris and the first thing I'm doing is sitting down to write a review for Hotel Le Six. That is how happy I was with my stay. I have absolutely no complaints, not even in the slightest. For easier reading, I will simply call out all the reasons why you should stay here if you're visiting Paris: (1) The rooms are fantastic. They feel like apartments. The bathrooms are modern and clean. The water pressure is perfect. They use Molton Brown products, very nice. The beds are so comfortable you are tempted to sleep in if only your agenda wasn't so packed. The rooms have small balconies, perfect for smoking a cigarette or having a glass of wine. The towels are soft and fluffy, they provide big robes and slippers.
